Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Experience in Japantown”
Reviews.Author: 3vilMonkey
Reviews.Content: Hotels in downtown San Francisco aren't cheap, but Tomo is definitely a bargain. Nice property, cute decor, friendly staff. Room service was very friendly and courteous, as well as the front desk. My only complaint about the property is that our room had no accessible electrical outlets. Zero. Nada. This explains why some of the furniture in the room was moved at odd angles away from the walls - so that the hidden electrical outlets behind the desk and nightstand could be found. There was a very nice and spacious computer desk, for example - but NO electrical outlets to use!! We had to pull the desk out further so that we could reach around to plug in our laptops. Same for charging the phone on the nightstand. This is a very easy issue to resolve - they need to install mounted power strips for easy access. This is obvious, but but I guess that doesn't keep people from ignoring it. At any rate - bring a power strip. More about the area: Japantown is a surprisingly nice and quiet area to stay, with an authentic Japanese urban feel. Unlike Chinatown, Japantown is an actual established Japanese community in the Pacific Heights area of the city. Lots of Japanese-Americans live in and work in this area - but there seemed to be very little tourist traffic overall. No crowds whatsoever... just a lot of "local" Japanese - it was a great place to start and end the day during our visit.

Reviews.Title: “No hot water?”
Reviews.Author: Chad B
Reviews.Content: I was on the 3rd floor. The first morning I took a shower and it was really cold. I went to the front desk later to inquire about it and unsurprisingly I was told it was probably cold because they had a full house and everyone uses the showers in the morning. He promised to have someone check my plumbing, but that was it. He just expected me to understand that predictably everyone in the place was using the shower in the morning (like you do) and therefor the water was cold. The next day I got up a little earlier and it was still quite cold, though not as unbearably as the first morning. I wouldn't hand out such a bad review all the time, but for me a one star means unsafe or unsanitary, and a two means that the hotel is missing the bare minimum amenities to be comfortable. Having a hot shower in the morning is pretty much all I require, and if a hotel doesn't provide that then it's just not acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Bad Value”
Reviews.Author: pharmgreg
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tomo on Cherry Blossom weekend. Great Location but Much prefer the Hotel Kabuki for comfort and value (it was booked, however!). Location is right across the street to Japantown and the Cherry Blossom Festival. Lots of great restuarants within 2 walking blocks. Kappa Japanese Restaurant we found to be the best real japanese food (omakase style). We also enjoyed Miyako and Iroha janpanese rest. Also the Koran House was very good. Japantown area is way away from most SF places and events but I had a conferance there. If you have the time make the venture down to the Ferry Building and evjoy the many food choices. Really enjoy the Slanted Door Rest! Saturday they have a farmers market at the Ferry Building and lots more to do and see.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: lzzc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my daughter's basketball tournament. When we got there we were told that parking was full (which I guess is apparently a normal problem) and we could park 2 blocks away at the Japantown garage. This was cheaper so we didn't mind that much but lugging luggage wasn't ideal. The rooms were cute with a full wall mural. The bathroom area obviously needed updating. There were large water damage spots in 3 places on the ceiling which were dry thank goodness but I was a bit worried about pieces of damaged ceiling falling on me. The beds were comfortable enough and I did enjoy the window seat. I guess it's not bad for a San Francisco hotel and the price was reasonable as well. The location was great for Japantown which was right across the street. It's an iffy walk to the union square area but SF is very walkable in general as long as you avoid problem areas.

Reviews.Title: “book it and bring earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: sher n
Reviews.Content: Positives: Fabulous location, easy to get everywhere in SF, extremely friendly staff, great price, kids love the anime. Negatives: the wooden bed frames are remarkably loud when jostled and earplugs would be a good idea to avoid being awakened at 2 am, 6 am, etc by other guests. Door slamming also causes a noise problem.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sue I
Reviews.Content: I use this hotel about 4 times a year to hold a conference as well as have people stay there. It is in a very convenient location, not the hustle and bustle of downtown. I love the unique art work, the friendly and helpful staff and the facilities really work for our event. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Sernovitz
Reviews.Content: Cute, clean, and in a really nice neighborhood. Highly recommended for business or family. + Fridge, Keurig coffee maker, and good wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly accomodating staff, great location, close to many eateries.”
Reviews.Author: Squeekie
Reviews.Content: I like the light furniture in the room, it's close to many eateries and in a great location in Japan town. Close to public transportation. The best thing in my opinion is the friendly and accomodating staff! I'd go back! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great value and comfort (large rooms!)”
Reviews.Author: stella8888
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Tomo three nights for my work-related trip and would definitely stay here again. First of all, the location is excellent. The hotel is located in the heart of Japantown, which is a great combination of interesting and safe. The restaurants and shops are plenty and good: definitely worth exploring. It is also blocks away from the stylish Filmore street where you can find excellent restaurants, bars and upscale boutiques. BART and many of the areas' most popular tourist attractions are a short bus ride away. Second, Hotel Tomo has large, clean rooms. The king-bed room that I stayed in was large enough to accommodate two adults comfortably and came with a good-size bathroom (unlike those tiny little ones found in many of the SF hotels), plenty of workspace, and FREE in-room wifi (for which many other hotels charge an exorbitant fee). The room was clean when I checked in. On one of the days of my stay, the maid did a sloppy job of cleaning it, but it was good the rest of the time. The decor of the room and the hotel is fun and quirky. If you are a fan of anime/manga, you will love it. If you prefer a more "traditional" hotel decor, you might feel a bit puzzled at staying at a room that is decorated like a bedroom of a Japanese teenager. I personally liked it. Although I am far from a teenager by decades, it was nice to stay in a room that felt more like a bedroom in a home than an impersonal/bland hotel room, especially when it had all the comforts of a hotel. Third, the value is great. It was cheaper than the B&B (as lovely in a vintage-sort of way as it was) I stayed at in my last trip! The restaurant in the hotel serves both "American" and Japanese breakfast options at a reasonable price (I enjoyed the Japanese option, which was excellent). Fourth, the staff at the hotel were efficient and attentive. To me, this is important. One tip: Although the hotel offers parking ($25 plus parking tax), you can park your car at the nearby Japan Center parking lot for much cheaper ($19, including the tax). I didn't find out about this until the last day, but now you know!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and comfort”
Reviews.Author: deranieri
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Tomo is a great value in a city that has a tendency toward great hotel expense. The rooms are large and comfortable. The location is within walking distance of some of the great up and coming restaurant and shop locales and BART is a short bus ride away. Staff is excellent -- our assigned room had a small problem, and when I brought it to staff's attention, we were immediately reassigned. The room was large, clean, and well-furnished with excellent wi-fi connections.

Reviews.Title: “good value, but some problems”
Reviews.Author: Tecalli
Reviews.Content: San Francisco is an expensive lodging destination and the Hotel Tomo provides value by proviiding a clean comfortable room with free wifi for a reasonable price. However, its important to keep in mind this is no luxury accomodations and the sub-Ikeaish furniture and murals are initially cute but wear off quickly. They apparently have a problem with their irons being stolen and I found it quite annoying to have to try and iron with the iron tied to the ironing board. The Japantown location isnt great. Its not really in walking distance to anything. However, the number 2 and 3 muni bus stop is right across the street and comes about every 20 min. providing access to Union Sq. If you are coming from the airport contact the hotel for shuttle transportation ($16 one way). Otherwise, tthe BART is $9 to the nearest station to the hotel and then $2 for the bus to the hotel-- much easier and quicker to take the shuttle. I did not find the hotel restaurant to be very good. However, there is an excellent Thai restaurant right across the street on Buchanan St. that offers very good food at reasonable prices. Hotel Tomo is fine for what it is-- reasonably priced accomodations in San Francisco. But a good location is definitely sacrificed for the reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “nice room, hotel staff just ok, restaurant terrible”
Reviews.Author: tusia_mm
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the comments here. The room was clean and nice. The bathroom clean, however they use those plastic curtains for the bathtub/shower and they always make me feel a bit gross. I like more it the glass is used. The cleaning staff is very very nice. Internet connection worked fine. Vending machines outside so if you forget to buy water you can get one outside your room for 1$ The reception staff leaves a lot to wish for. Most of them are just ok. Nothing special. There's one woman (Asian look, dont know where she's from) who's very rude. She makes you feel like she's doing you a favour being there. The restaurant in that hotel is just terrible. The first day we went for breakfast there. I took continental and I got a bun and a cup of tea. My husband took egg, sausage and toast with coffee. We paid more than 30$ for it!!! We put on the table 40$ and waited for 15min for the change! Once they realize we are not leaving without our 10$ they brought the change. After this we didn't even think of leaving the tip. Additionally, we were served like: eat and get out. To make it clear it's a Japanese restaurant so the staff is Japanese (at I assume so). Except us there were few Asian families. They were served and left in peace to eat. We were served and once one of us finished (me that one small bun) they took away from me the plate, than the cup were I had tea - all made us feel like "just eat, get out and leave a big tip"... If not the woman at the reception desk and the restaurant the hotel would be much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, appropriate accommodations and location”
Reviews.Author: Thiago_Rio
Reviews.Content: Good SF Hotels don't come cheap, and this one managed to be convenient location-wise, while not that expensive (though "budget" wouldn't necessarily fit here). A cheap bus ride right in front of the hotel takes you to Union Square and pretty much anywhere else you need to go. Staff was friendly and helpful, and the rooms were quite spacious. I would definitely recommend the Tomo Hotel on Sutter.

Reviews.Title: “Great end to 2011”
Reviews.Author: lo_angle
Reviews.Content: Spent New Year's weekend 2011 here. Great stay--the rooms are cool, ours had a little window seat overlooking the street that was nice. Did add some limited street noise, but the sun and air were worth the tradeoff. Walking distance to everywhere we wanted to go, good neighborhood with lots of local flavor, close to bus line, etc. The cable TV wasn't working and they fixed it quickly and also hooked us up with a late checkout. All systems go.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy...”
Reviews.Author: AeroAtty
Reviews.Content: Paper thin walls and a lot of outside noise on the first floor. Helpful staff but with all the noise contributing to a lack of sleep, it takes more than an attentive desk clerk to change this reviewer's experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service and a Clean Place to Sleep”
Reviews.Author: Morris1524
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely decorated with murals. The room was clean. The frame of the bed sticks out and is easy to bang your foot/leg on so be careful. There were 3 things that were not ideal: 1. Noise from the hall came in pretty well. 2. We were not informed that it would cost us $25 per day to park. 3. The restaurant was not good for breakfast. On the plus side, it is a short walk to Soko Hardware.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: tannerSF
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on three separate occasions and on each return trip the service just gets worse. The hotel staff, housekeeping, and management are not guest service oriented. My advise would be to pick a different Joie de Vivre property if you want a great experience on your trip to SF!

Reviews.Title: “Pefect Location”
Reviews.Author: Richard W
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night. Perfect location close to Fillmore and all the restaurants and Yoshi's. Spacious room. Parking is self parking below for only $25 a night. Bed was very comfortable and we loved the wild artwork.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel not far from downtown SF”
Reviews.Author: empTeee
Reviews.Content: We drove from LA to San francisco, but didnt buy any hotels before we travelled. When we got to San Francisco this was the 3rd hotell we tried. It was the cheapest and had by far the best rooms. Actually, the first room we got had some noise from the window because it wouldnt close proparly, but we asked them and we got to change rooms. The hotel was close to some popular restaurants in Japantown. It is also pretty close to downtown. We usually walked everywhere from the hotel and tok a taxi back when we where tired.

Reviews.Title: “Nice simple hotel in clean and quiet part of town.”
Reviews.Author: scottjmelbourne
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights as part of a 3 week honeymoon to the USA. It is a nice and quiet part of town, and is a far enough separated from the areas of SF that look/feel a little seedy. The walk to Union Square is about 20 minutes, over fairly modest hills, as far as SF is concerned, or the 'Muni' bus that's stops right out the front will get you there a little easier for a couple of bucks. Hotel is nice and clean / reasonably modern, and basic Queen room is nice and spacious. The only negatives were: - Our thermostat was not very reliable, and had to be reset a couple of times. The last night when it needed it was after hours, and there were no maintenance there to assist when I couldn't do it. They offered a room switch, but it was going to be inconvenient so we didn't take it up. - We had a couple of pillow cases with us for dirty laundry, and housekeeping accidentally picked one up which contained a couple of pairs of dirty underwear. The hotel was unable to track them down for us. Overall, still an enjoyable stay though.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Hotel to stay at”
Reviews.Author: DNPRAHLAD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Tomo because it was close to my son's apartment for the last few days of our trip. Hotel Tomo was a pleasant surprise. It used to be a Best Western and now is not and hence we did not get reward points. The rooms had wonderful view on higher floors, being naturally higher. The staff were nice and warm, typical of San Francisco. The area itself, Japantown, is very peaceful. There a fair amount of eating places in Fillmore. Do not miss out on buffet at Indian Palace. The place does not have looks but the food is great. Clean rooms, airy and comfortable an spacious. Good value for money in a big city.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Julia T
Reviews.Content: Tomo hotel was a pleasant surprise. It is extremely well-maintained and had very clean service. For a party of 3, I stayed in a room with double queen beds which was very spacious and comfortable. There was also a mini gym which was a huge plus (although I prefer running outside, my sister was able to utilize the gym in the time that we were there)! The hotel is also well-located, right in front of Japantown on Sutter st. Japan town in itself is extremely intriguing and had lots to see, with many restaurants as well as a cinema a block away. Overall, my family and I really enjoyed our stay at Tomo and would definitely stay here again for our nxt visit!

Reviews.Title: “not worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: denissita
Reviews.Content: I returned to this hotel hoping it would be a great stay, because I stayed at this hotel when it was owned by best western, I decided to return horrible mistake, last time the staff was amazing now well you can imagine why the low grade. it sucks to be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable Hotel Tomo”
Reviews.Author: Tribecaphile
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay for one night in SF, and didn't want to spend much more than $100. We got exactly what we needed: a room for approx. $100 in a very cute hotel. The room had a great mod feel and was surprisingly spacious. It was clean and modern with nice simple furniture and a comfy kingsize bed. The staff were extremely warm and welcoming - no city 'tude. The location, while not exactly in the midst of a super-happening area, is nicely central and accessible to public transportation and some of the major traffic arteries of the city - Geary as well as Van Ness. I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, outside of touristy areas in SF”
Reviews.Author: JourneyingLife
Reviews.Content: We've stayed two times at Hotel Tomo while visiting family. Because it's in a residential area, you have lots of parking options and don't need to spend the $25 to park at the hotel's garage. Hotel is in good shape. And if you enjoy Japanese anime type art, you'll appreciate the art here. We have very young children though and I made a request to get a room that didn't have scary or dark artwork. The hotel staff didn't see my request. (I had booked through Best Western's website online.) When I arrived and made the same request in person, the person helping me was a little off-putting. She was not unprofessional; she just made me feel like I was making a strange request. Perhaps our personalities just did not mesh. She said she had no idea what art work is in each room. (There's so many rooms.) I didn't expect her to know which room had scary art; I just wanted to know whether I could come back and change rooms if I found that the art work was not suitable for young children. I went to the assigned room and didn't like the art work so I asked if I could get another room. Another staff person was present and she commented that there's lots of availability, so I can keep looking until I find a suitable room. The first person who helped me then gave me two keys to two additional rooms to check out. That was nice. I did find an ok room. I appreciated being able to do that. Since it was Thanksgiving/November when we stayed, it was cold. The room always had a draft coming in from the front door. I tried to fix it by putting some towels around the edges. We couldn't get the heat to work. I noticed that they now have a Keurig coffee machine in every room. It didn't make a difference to us (we don't drink coffee). But it's nice that it was there. Having a mini-refrigerator was nice, too. Housekeeping was awesome. They had to deal with dirty diapers in our trash cans daily. It's expensive to stay in the city, so this hotel is a pretty good option for the location and price.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location. So,so hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shelley5655
Reviews.Content: The location was convenient. The room was small and stuffy. We paid extra for a balcony but soon discovered it was so small you could barely stand on it. There were not enough outlets to charge out electronics and no air conditioning. We had to request a fan and keep our sliding door to the balcony open for adequate ventilation. The refrigerator did not work. The exercise room was small. I would not choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Was good, 5 years ago?”
Reviews.Author: lovestocycle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights, taking up a good deal that landed in our inbox. For the price we paid for a 2 night stay in San Francisco we got our money's worth for sure. However, we paid budget prices and received that. we stayed in a joye de vivre hotel in LA and were blown away by it. This one looks great on its website... but the room was showing signs of neglect. The fun looking stencils on the wall were faded and had been scuffed, had pen marks - just general wear and tear. Sadly the same can be said of the rest of the hotel... all just looking like it had received no more than essential maintenance for a number of years. The garage they have for parking is small and I thought a bit steep ($25 per day) - we parked it on the street for free at night. Service was a bit slow at times for my liking too (getting through to reception took more effort than it should (3 calls before someone picked up).

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain”
Reviews.Author: AllieTacoma
Reviews.Content: Hotel Tomo is a bargain- I got a great rate online and it's in a nice quiet neighborhood which is centrally located, easy access to bus lines. Rooms are large and clean. We had a room facing the inner courtyard which was totally quiet- a rarity in SF. The Anime stylings may not be to your taste but you're not living there permanently! I liked the deer on our wall! The staff was friendly and very responsive- our mini-fridge wasn't working and was replaced within 15 min. I agree the "High Speed" internet was awful. Better to go to a local cafe than torture yourself waiting. Bathroom was normal sized- I've never had a big bathroom in SF in any of the historic luxury hotels that cost twice as much.

Reviews.Title: “The City by the Bay”
Reviews.Author: ASeasonedTraveler54
Reviews.Content: The staff was very nice. The room had a nice work area but the internet service was terrible. The room lacked a comfortable padded upholstered type chair or sofa. The room and bath was clean. The shower was excellent, great water pressure. The A/C is not very responsive. It was difficult to cool down the room.

Reviews.Title: “Not awful, not great”
Reviews.Author: whatkatiedoes
Reviews.Content: We liked the location of the hotel - opposite Japantown and a short walk to the lovely shops and cafes on Fillmore St. The room was large and clean but a bit shabby, bathroom definitely not luxury at all and not really the fun manga-styled experience we were expecting (the advertised retro videogames are paid-for). Unfortunately we were in a room right next to the rented-out conference room which meant it was extremely noisy for our first weekend - the hotel offered a room switch. We also heard the lifts, maintenance work, and other bathrooms running water through the thin walls. Staff were all fairly courteous but didn't go out of their way to be helpful. Free wifi in the room worked fine but was slow. In general the hotel was alright but I'd probably stay elsewhere if I returned to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Skip rm 812”
Reviews.Author: TrvlChica88
Reviews.Content: So my girls and I were in the City for a night out and picked Hotel Tomo for the location...The room and hotel weren't bad if anime is your style...kinda cool but I didn't actually book it my friend did. Long story short we came back in around midnight and we go in our room and opened the sliding glass to the door to go on the balcony, it was awesome..a great view. However, when we go back in and I go to attempt to turn on the TV (which is a rather unusuall process btw) and all the sudden I get hit in my mid-back and it stung like hell! I immediately fell on the bed and was in shock and pain because I didn't know what just happened. Come to find out, after finding the evidence on the carpet the next a.m. a blue round pellet, I was shot at by a pellet gun! It literally came through the opened sliding glass door and hit me in my back. My cousin and friends checked my back and I had a welt! We then were totally freaked out, where the hell did that come from we were on the 8th floor!? We went to the Front desk and all we were basically told was it never happened before and if it happens AGAIN call the Cops. Really...well ya pretty much 'shot' the experience from cool to down right freaky and kinda scary!

Reviews.Title: “Great service & staff though aging room”
Reviews.Author: GochisoGourmet
Reviews.Content: On the positive, Hotel Tomo is in a great location in Japantown with hotel parking or public parking about 1 block away (same parking as Kabuki Hotel). The staff was also very friendly and helpful and the room cost was okay. Now the downside... the AC never worked during our stay with the room temperature at about 80 degrees at night and unbearable in the early afternoon. The room also has that electrical system that only allows the TV and AC to work if the room key (card) is inserted - twice it went off while I was brewing my morning coffee (while the card was still inserted) so I had to find my morning brew elsewhere. To the staff's credit, they did erase our parking charges each day ($25) and reduced the room rate for our inconvenience. I would return if the AC issues get resolved - I visit the Bay Area for cold, I can get hot in the 50th...

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, moderately priced for San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: sk1955
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay here, the third in Japantown. The area is centrally located and easier to manuever from than Fisherman's Wharf (by car). Great breakfast spots around Fillmore Street. Parking is tight, but it is San Francisco. Staff will work with you. AC is a bit of an issue, but again its San Francisco. If you don't need five star comfort, this is a great place to stay. Feel more like you live there than a tourist!

Reviews.Title: “Domo arigato, Hot-el TOMO!”
Reviews.Author: hejiranyc
Reviews.Content: Far from the madding crowds of Union Square and Nob Hill is the relatively tranquil calm of Japantown, which appears to be comprised of a sizeable Japanese shopping/dining pavilion surrounded by various structures vaguely resembling traditional Japanese buildings. Right on the edge of Japantown is a blocky, almost brutalistic Best Western Hotel circa the late 1960s/early 1970s, complete with popcorn ceilings and metal doors. But it seems that someone came up with the brilliant idea to go way left of center with the inevitable renovation. Rather than aspiring to some kind of zen retreat ala the nearby Kabuki Hotel, why not do something cheap but fun? Instead of dark stained ebony, use knotty pine. Instead of images of geishas and crashing waves, why not channel kitschy Harajuku and manga fabulousity? The result is something that is less Akira Kurosawa and more Akira, the animated manga movie. The Hotel TOMO! was born. The room itself was very large, especially by San Francisco standards, and was quite comfortable and stylish, including a flat screen TV, a hanging George Nelson ball lamp and free wi-fi. The restaurant served Japanese-style fare (big surprise, I know), and in typical Japanese fashion, the portions were tiny but tasty. The "exercise room" on the fourth floor was nothing but a few treadmills. If you are looking for a real workout, take a brisk walk over to 24-hour Fitness on Van Ness.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great”
Reviews.Author: KAmandaR
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights on a business trip. The room itself was clean; however, the furniture seemed cheap and the art was creepy. My sheets had a hole in them. On my first morning, a housekeeper barged in my room, even though I had the "do not disturb" sign on the door. Nothing worked properly either. The AC blew hot air. The first night was a warm one, and the room was miserably hot. My television didn't work, and the high speed internet was a joke. Whenever I was able to actually get on the network, the service was incredibly slow. I wound up going to a coffee shop so that I could get some work done. The location wasn't too terrible, and I was able to always find a taxi. Japantown is a neat area of San Francisco. I highly recommend it; however, I do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We've been staying here since the '80s”
Reviews.Author: Suyoga
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to this hotel many times in all three of its incarnations, Kyoto Inn, Miyako Inn, and now Hotel Tomo. We love the location, in a calmer very central area of SF. It's right in the middle with easy access to Fisherman's Wharf, Golden Gate Park, the Marina, Union Square. And of course, Japan Town restaurants and stores and Fillmore Street cafés. The room feels spacious, even with two queen beds. We like to pay the few extra dollars and get a room with a balcony on an upper floor. I love the colors and Manga mural; it's unique and cheerful. Plus, the bedding is very comfy. It is in an older building, though, so there aren't many outlets to charge electronic devices. We'll stay here in the future trips too although it just keeps getting pricier, especially with the SF city taxes.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: riddler20
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and useful location close to Fillmore Street where if you head north from Sutter Street there is a nice selection of cafes and restaurants. The hotel itself is bright and cheerful with Manga style decor in the rooms and lobby. The rooms themselves are a nice size and very comfortable. The only negative comment I have is that the ice machine on the third floor is noisy enough to be intrusive if you're a light sleeper. The wireless network was variable but the hotel reception lent me an Ethernet lead to plug into the fixed network which worked perfectly. I would recommend this hotel particularly to families.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location --”
Reviews.Author: DK808
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location adjacent to Japantown. We had no need to use the restaurant in the hotel with so many great selections right across the street. The room and bath were clean and well kept up. If you have a car, parking is available for a price at the hotel, however, overnight parking at the Japan Center is $8 - $9 cheaper. No car is no problem, there is an MTA bus adjacent to the hotel. WiFi service was spotty, at least on the 2nd floor, but it's hard to complain too much about a free service. Overall, a great stay in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific!”
Reviews.Author: Julibean18
Reviews.Content: Totally cool hotel. Awesome Japanese-inspired furnishings. Super-comfy linens, thick towels, great shower. Great quality toiletries. Pleasant staff. Wonderful stay! Would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nancy1919
Reviews.Content: This reasonably priced hotel is based in the Japasntown area of San Francisco. I was on the top floor, floor 8, which had a great view over part of the city. The room was very spacious and spotlessly clean, with a very comfortable bed. The bathroom was fine, with lovely toiletries. The wash basin was separate. There was a safe in the room, which was easy to use. My only complaints are minor in that it was difficult to get just hot water if I wanted to make a cup of tea - there is a coffee maker in the room, but I couldn't get it to work for tea. Also, one night I could smell the cooking from the hotel restaurant on the 1st floor and there are a few stains on the hall carpets that could do with a bit of shampooing. The carpets in the room are fine. There is a bus stop just outside the hotel with regular buses going to and from Union Square. There are a lot of restaurants near the hotel and a couple of lovely little shopping malls, selling lots of Japanese items. The Peace Pagoda is just down the street from the hotel. Overall I'd recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: saeed42
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel, very clean and close to Fillmore street which has great night life and a lot of restaurants. I loved the room decorations with Japanese art twist.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best deals you can find in SF”
Reviews.Author: gurkEL
Reviews.Content: this hotel is a total satisfaction for the rates it charges.. everything from the lobby to the rooms make you feel good about staying here. the rooms are spacious w comfy beds and are good design. located in the japanese district it really has a hip and distinct character.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mindy c
Reviews.Content: This summer we made our first trip to San Francisco. We brought our 3 children ages 7, 6 and 3 months. Not being very city saavy and blindly choosing this hotel I was a bit nervous. We had an amazing time thanks to the incredible staff here. They were very helpful especially Gerardo, who made us feel at home. We felt safe in this area, the hotel inside and out was very clean. I have never written a review before but I felt like I needed to share how awesome this place was.

Reviews.Title: “Cool pad”
Reviews.Author: Jazzkitten
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance of Yoshi's Jazz Club in San Francisco, Tomo has it all. Parking, so very precious in the city. They have a nice underground garage to park your ride. Access to JapanTown is fabulous. Great sushi and shopping across the street. Tomo also has its own little place to eat and drink. The bar could be open a little later in my opinion. The rooms here are nice. Very groovy Japanese decor. Sometimes all we can spare is one night from home and Tomo has a two night minimum stay.

Reviews.Title: “All what you need”
Reviews.Author: kabouzeid
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located in the middle of SFO. Rooms are nice and clean, the lady manager is so sweet and nice… the Male manager at the early A.M. is a non friendly man.. maybe cause he wakes up early :) parking is always full, but since you pay for it, they have to let you in.. rooms beside you are sometimes noisy if you have bad neighbors but over all if you are on a budget and visiting SFO its the perfect hotel you have in room safes, clean bathroom, large room, vending machines everywhere, so you dont really need anything more :)

Reviews.Title: “Rooms good, staff unhelpful and rude”
Reviews.Author: Aine O
Reviews.Content: This hotel was good value for me and my 3 girlfriends however we had bad experiences with lots of the staff. Firstly i phoned the hotel from Ireland one day and while I know it was early in the morning for the person who answered, they were so unfriendly and rude. I usually just take this kind of attitude but on this occassion I had to comment on it becuase I could not believe what I was hearing. I had just paid this hotel $800 and this person's attitude was terrible. On arrival then one of my girlfriends had an unfriendly experience with reception when checking in. Then on our second day we asked for some help with directions and were basically told we were stupid by the lady at reception. We are all seasoned travellers and never experienced anything like the poor customer service at this location. I have to say that the bar maid in the restarant was very friendly so no complaints there. Having said this the rooms were fine and if you can stay away from the staff you'll have an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was awful - I won't be coming back”
Reviews.Author: MayreauG
Reviews.Content: First of all, the pictures of the hotel on the site are nothing like what you actually experience; I wish I had taken more pictures to show you. The lobby is shabby, the rooms are just full of Ikea furniture, and I had a number of other unpleasant experiences: * When I arrived, I waited 15 minutes for someone to show up at the front desk *When someone did show up, they couldn't care less about their job * When I got to my room: * the carpets were covered in stains * the shower had mildew on the walls * the tub drain was semi-clogged - very slow to drain * the bathroom had one recessed light, and if the door was closed, it was VERY dark in the shower * the towels they provide are very thin and scratchy * the clock was 5 hours off *no ethernet cord (though they did provide an ethernet outlet) * the wireless network was unusably slow * half of the tv channels don't work * the (extremely cheap) iron was literally leashed to its dock, and the dock was bolted to the ironing board, making half of it unusable, and the other half very awkward to use. Who locks their iron? At the end of my stay, no one asked how my stay was or had any interest in improving their hotel. And staying here for business is terribly inconvenient - being in Japantown, cabs don't generally come by unless they're called. I usually had to walk 6 blocks to a more populated area to find a cab in less than 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Utah1310
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights with our four year-old and a baby. Room was nice/funky and very clean. Great, safe neighborhood. We recommend "Sweet Maple" for breakfast, a short walk away. Staff was very friendly and helpful. My husband was only a bit disappointed that he had to pay for the extra coffee when the two caffeinated Keurig coffees were gone. The second night the garage was full, but the parking garage of the Japan Center was just a two minute walk away and was actually 9 Dollars cheaper than the parking in the hotel. Getting there in the morning with the luggage was no problem. We did not try the restaurant nor the public transportation, so I cannot comment on those. Would come again! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for a decent price in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: sandrita55
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in Japan town, and has kind of Japanese anime decor. Our room was clean, had a refrigerator and keurig coffee maker (makes individual cups of coffee), and had an anime - looking "mural" on one wall. I enjoyed the room, though the pillows were on the uncomfortable side and they could have had better lighting in the bathroom. The hotel is within walking distance of a lot of restaurants. We enjoyed Sweet Maple for breakfast. The front desk staff was always friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Japanese Anime Meets IKEA & Mumins”
Reviews.Author: AdventureLass
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night, and had read all the TA reviews prior to selecting this location. It's a quirky Japanese-Asian style place, with Asian decor that felt like a cross between Japanese Anime, IKEA, and Mumins. Very colorful throughout. The lobby has 3 computers for customer use, although the two terminals I tried labored heavily in opening a web page. In attempting to print a boarding pass, one front desk person said the printer worked fine, and another said it hasn't worked in weeks. After giving the printer some TLC and paper, it worked just fine. My room was very clean and overlooked the back courtyard/neighborhood. The bed was comfortable, but sat in a wooden platform that creaked loudly with every move. There was free wi-fi in the room which I did not use. The hallways were quiet during my stay. There were soda vending machines on my floor and in the lobby area. Checkout was friendly and helpful in calling me a cab. I didn't think the value received was worth the price, but then again, this is San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality, a Bit Worn”
Reviews.Author: Dead R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Tomo! from Aug 24 to 28th in a regular Double bed room on the 6th floor. We were attracted by the special rate we got online via their site and the fun atmosphere the hotel displays in their marketing. I'll be clear here: I liked the hotel. It was clean and centrally located and was a few steps away from major bus routes into other parts of the city. But the "overlay" of Japanese Graphic Design on top of a regular Best Western was a bit worn. The mural in our room was ripped up near by the bed. No surprise when you wallpaper in a high traffic area, but it detracted from the "atmosphere". The rest of the room was clean and in good quality. Also, I've read on here that the hotel was noisy. I particularly liked the review from the dorks who complained about being kicked out of Hotel Tomo for partying - sorry... "laughing" - in the middle of the night. Reading between the lines in that review tells me they were drunk college kids and I would have done the same to them if I were the front desk staff. The rooms *do* leak sound: the doors on our floor seem to slam with loud drum like intensity if you just let them close on their own and I could hear someone above our room open and close drawers. But after 11pm (the time Hotel Tomo repeatedly reminds it's patrons is "quiet time") we had no problems with noise at all. Front desk staff were always friendly and helpful. The hotel says they participate in "recycling" towels by hanging towels to reuse, or throwing towels on the bathroom floor to be replaced, but every time we hung our towels, one or both were taken away and replaced. *shrug*. In all a good quality hotel, located centrally in San Francisco. We'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for families, but not so for business people”
Reviews.Author: JJGoodell
Reviews.Content: Located in Japan Town in SFO, Hotel Tomo is a European-style hotel. Accommodation is good, walls are painted with Japanese-style cartoons, which is very fanciful and great for the kids. Very clean and restaurant is good as well. Staff is wonderful. However, if you're looking for a hotel where you can conduct business online in the morning or evening, I'd suggest going some where else. The "fast" speed Internet connection is very intermittent. I couldn't even get onto the network the morning we left.

Reviews.Title: “Not brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: bertiet_11
Reviews.Content: Interestingly themed Hotel in Japantown area of San Francisco but underneath facade just another Best Western. Room was ok but felt a little grubby, emphasised by large spill/stain on carpet when we arrived. That aside, room was clean and a good size with novelty mural on wall. Reception staff were efficient without being over friendly but sorted our airport transfer which seemed good value. Overall was ok but a bit remote from Union Square and main tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a quiet neighborhood in SF”
Reviews.Author: Protocolnine
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over a weekend during our 3 week holiday in the US and it was a nice place. We loved the neighborhood. Japantown is much quieter than Union Square or Fishermans's Wharf but still easily accessible and we always felt safe, also when returning at night. The rooms are large and clean with coffee/tea making facilities and an Ipod docking station. Hallway noise does seep into the room, though, but we always slept well. We had no problem with noise coming from other rooms. The parking was full when we arrived, but we parked in Japan Center, which is only a block away and cheaper than the hotel (16USD per 24H as opposed to 25), a bargain for SF. Breakfast in the restaurant on the 1st floor is overpriced and not included in the room, but there are a few possibilities in the vicinity (Japantown shopping center). Good value for SF.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem Near Japantown...enjoy the murals and anime!”
Reviews.Author: TelemarkDenver
Reviews.Content: If my vacation had to be interrupted by two nights in the hospital at California Pacific Medical Center, there's no place I'd rather that my family stayed than Hotel Tomo. Not just because they were offered a discount as family of a CPMC patient, or that the nearby Japantown and Fillmore Street businesses provided for our every need and often our great delight, but also because this little gem of Japanese style meets Best Western Hotel was just the place for them to relax while I was admitted, and for me to relax after being discharged. Child friendly - they play anime in the lobby - and magnificent murals in the rooms, this newly appointed property is a find for new and even frequent visitors to The City. Price, location, CLEANLINESS, and a unique approach will delight you too. Also enjoyed the on-site restaurant for breakfast - I ate the traditional Japanese version. These folks went above and beyond a few times during our short stay, and have guaranteed that we'll be back every time we visit SF.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlandPat
Reviews.Content: I liked the modern Japanese/Ikea look mto the hotel. Very clean and comfortable room with upscale accessories, (Keurig pod coffee maker, high tech phones and power sources). We had a large comfortable platform bed. Great neighborhood with many interesting restaurants on nearby Fillmore Street. Japanese food available across the street at Asian styled complex. Staff was friendly and helpful. Despite last minute reservation for which I am thankful, thought the price of $219 before taxes on a Tuesday night was pretty steep.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, friendly , good location”
Reviews.Author: Nacii
Reviews.Content: Tomo hotel in Japan town is a nice small simple hotel. Good value for San Francisco, nice staff. Wi Fi isn't working all the time..need more investment there. Very clean and pleasant. Good choice for a family.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Tomo sucks”
Reviews.Author: Tnunnster
Reviews.Content: The free wi-fi was annoyingly unreliable. The TV remote didn't work. Our reservation for adjoining rooms was not honored. The front desk staff barely spoke English and could not effectively meet our needs because of it. Don't waste your money at Hotel Tomo.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, good value”
Reviews.Author: Apeks
Reviews.Content: Old hotel which is changed to a funky stile. Room was nice and AC worked fine. Wireless also worked fine and the staff was nice. Location is nice and there is a bus just outside the door taking you downtown. Never tried to eat at the hotel since out rate did not included breakfast. All in all, good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great place with a great location”
Reviews.Author: looski
Reviews.Content: Hotel Tomo is a fun place with fun decor. A mixture of dorm and anime this hotel is comfortable, good price, great location, extremely helpful and friendly staff, especially Romelia and Geraldo. Their restaurant has American or Japanese food. Breakfast was good, and enough for two women to split and be satisfied. The only thing I didn't like were their hard pillows - most hotels seem to have them. It's best to take your own - if you're picky. Sheets were nice and comfortable. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Funky place”
Reviews.Author: ramblingsalesman
Reviews.Content: Funky place with funky decorating, spotless, helpful staff if you can get past the wiern murals on the room walls. It was almost like some Hotel's in amsterdam that I've stayed in. Perhaps that was the inspiration.

Reviews.Title: “Fun decor; Great Location for Japantown or Fillmore St.”
Reviews.Author: Khaton13
Reviews.Content: If you want to shop on Fillmore Street and go to Japantown or the Kabuki this is the place to stay. It is very inexpensive. The lobby has fun decor with 3 TVs running cartoons that are all different. The room itself has queen beds and lots of wood. It was very quiet. The only thing negative was the room wasn't ready after check in and the housekeeper sent me down to get another room.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience.”
Reviews.Author: lenabradley
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was super friendly. They really gave the impression that they wanted you to enjoy yourself and wanted you to walk away happy. Rooms were bright and funky think ikea. Very clean. It is only 45 min walk to fishermans wharf and 30 min walk to chinatown. overall it was a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay, well worth it for the price”
Reviews.Author: Durhamite
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple nights while taking in SF and a Giants game. Had made a phone reservation for 2 nights for the family and 1 night for my parents, which was mixed up slightly upon check-in, but quickly resolved by the efficient front desk staff. I had asked for adjoining rooms and even though not assigned initially, they quickly got things arranged to my satisfaction. Was a busy weekend in SF with many hotels charging much more, so we were quite pleased with the hotel, the quiet location, nearby to Fillmore St restaurants, for a decent price. The 2nd floor room was good sized and even had a window seat with lots of sunlight coming in. HBO included so we were able to see a couple movies once in for the night. Nice shower with a high, large showerhead. Lots of fluffy pillows! Free wireless internet kept the kids "connected" with no complaints. Good Japanese restaurant on site that we all enjoyed one evening. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Figueric
Reviews.Content: This is an old hotel with a fancy makeup. Parking lot full even for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great value. Everything I could have wanted for the price.”
Reviews.Author: darrenhailes
Reviews.Content: I saved about 50% compared to staying in a downtown hotel. It was easy to find by bus. Staff were courteous and efficient. The rooms were comfortable, neat and clean. Everything worked properly. Would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: nyc005
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively for work and spent 5 days at Hotel Tomo. The staff was spectacular! Very helpful, courteous, and just simply nice. My room was very cute, cheerfully designed and comfortable. I wish I had more business in San Fran just to stay at the hotel. By far the nicest staff that I have met. It reminded me of the wonderful service I received in Japan on another business trip last year. Surprised at the last review by a guest who also stayed in the hotel in May. The decor is anime, not sure what she was expecting but overall it's a lovely, modest, hotel with wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay but won't be back”
Reviews.Author: Greens3
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and it wasn't noisy. Located very near Japan Town. Had a small fridge but no mircowave. Not as "animee" decorated as we were expecting. (Stayed there for our daughter who likes animee) No pool. Nothing fancy. Just "okay." I booked a room on line and the desk clerk wouldn't do anything for me but give me the customer service number.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise in a residential area”
Reviews.Author: originalglobalgirl
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise to find this hotel in my old hood in San Francisco. I was back to visit storage and spend the night on my way to China. When I lived in the Fillmore district for over two years, I never even noticed this hotel - it was not frills, but clean, and quite large - better than some 5 star hotels I have stayed at. The staff was very, very helpful. The only downside was a very slow internet in the room and in the lobby. A few guests also complained. For $129 dollars, I could not beat the price. I will stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: h2onab
Reviews.Content: The quirky Hotel Tomo gets my rating as a very good value hotel for expensive San Francisco. Centrally located in Japantown, it is a convenient anchor for trips around the city if you have a car. There is nothing fancy about the hotel. Expect minimalism but it is clean, the staff helpful and you shouldn't be spending much time in a hotel room anyway. Check around for room rates since it can change weekly. For example, I booked at one rate, checked back a few weeks later and saved $30/night. There are good restaurants and shopping in Japantown and on Fillmore Street. It may be a Best Western but it is also part of the Joie de Vivre hotel group which has upgraded the property.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location but fine hotel and comfy rooms.”
Reviews.Author: MexTraveler27
Reviews.Content: Very near the SF Film festival and The Fillmore district

Reviews.Title: “Cute and Funky”
Reviews.Author: AnCo83
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a really great value in the city at only $150 a night. It's clean, quiet and centrally located in Japantown. The staff was friendly and helpful. We stayed in a Deluxe King room that offered a comfortable (on the firm side) king bed, desk space, a small dining area and an alcove window seat that overlooked Japantown. We had a great view of the Pagoda and of the area's shopping and restaurants. This place is very visually interesting with giant, anime murals on the walls and on the ceiling of the lobby. I really enjoyed my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Dormlike Japanese Styled Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ILoveWaffles
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of Japantown is this hotel. Parking is limited (I think only 20 cars could fit there) & there was a fee - I think it was around $25/night or so, I don't really remember. The hotel didn't seem to have that many employees - they call in the morning to ask if you would want your room cleaned later & at what time because I think the housekeepers leave at a certain time. Also, at night, there seems to be only one employee downstairs, actually maybe even in the day also. There is a restaurant connected to it, but I didn't get a chance to go, I am going to try to eat there next time I am in town. The room had a small fridge, a small flat screen, and free internet. The light in the bathroom when first turned on was dim but it slowly got brighter the longer you kept it on. A large bean bag chair was also in the room, kind of cute. The hotel is literally only a five second walk into the stores and restaurants of Japantown. The parking spaces were a little small also. If you come back late there is very high chance that there will be no space in the lot for your car. Luckily, there was free street parking available around the hotel the few nights we stayed there, you just have to move it by, I think, 9 or 10am.

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel with Anime theme”
Reviews.Author: gardenmomof2
Reviews.Content: We arrived in San Francisco with no plans. We looked and found this hotel that sounded a little different then all the others in a price we liked. So we figured we would give it a try. It was a fun hotel right next to the Japantown mall. Both my boys enjoyed walking through the mall and exploring all of San Francisco. The only this we would complain about is that they have limited parking but you can park a street over at the mall for $7 less then if you parked at the hotel. The hotel had a robe in the room that was a nice surprise and one night we tried the hotel restaurant for Shabu Shabu. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the bed”
Reviews.Author: Earnie24
Reviews.Content: Its was really cute Hotel to stayed, I didn't expect anything much so it was a pretty good hotel. I loveeee their beddd it's sooo comfyyyy. =DDD it just felt like at home. However, my room was next to the ice machine so it was a bit noisy. Over all it was good.

Reviews.Title: “A bargain in the City”
Reviews.Author: Salt_City_Sue
Reviews.Content: This fun hotel with its Japanese anime theme is located right across the street from Japantown's mall with its fascinating shops and restaurants. Our view over the City's hills was excellent. There is adequate cab service and good bus transportation to reach other areas of San Francisco as well. About 15 minutes to the Financial District and the same to Golden Gate Park. Beds were comfy. Only complaint: the hotel restaurant did not offer a good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: happymom2011
Reviews.Content: I sent my daughter and her girlfriend to this hotel for her birthday. They were going to a concert at the Filmore. As a nervous mom, I made several calls to the front desk to make sure they arrived safely and that the 3rd party payment was ok, and that they had parking. The hotel was so patient with me and very helpful. I found out later when my daughter returned that the front desk was sooo very helpful to her. They informed her of taxi's and other things they needed to know. I am so thankful to them. I am planning a trip soon there myself. Oh yea, my daughter loved the room and hotel! The only drawback is the parking. But there is overflow parking nearby. Thanks Tomo!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome - awesome - awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Battistak
Reviews.Content: Hotel Tomo was just amazing! The Service was great, rooms were siper clean and the price was unbelievable! We highly recommend hotel tomo if you are traveling in the SF area. Its also very convenient to many tourist destinations as well. I felt very safe walking throughout the area and taking the buses too! Cant wait to go back! Thanks :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: adwiggs89
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 3 other friends from Mar 24-29 and didn't have any problems. Everyday our beds were made and towels replinshed, however it wouldn't have bothered me to make my own bed or reuse a towel, but still a nice touch. The restaurant staff was very friendly, however I do wish the bar stayed open a little longer but I do understand it is a restaurant and bar. That was the only bad part of my entire stay which I can get over. I would definitly recommend this hotel to anyone. It was within walking distance of most areas and if not, the bus could take you anywhere for $2. The staff at the front desk was very willing to give us change upon request because the bus only takes exact change. If you can get a room with a window seat then definitly do it because the views were gorgeous in the morning. STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “We love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Cherrykim
Reviews.Content: This place is fantastic. We have been travelling around California for the past three weeks, and out of the hotels we've been staying in, this just puts them all to shame. The rooms are spacious and we love the decor! Feel like we really get looked after also. Would recommend this hotel highly!!! There is a bus stop over the road, the buses go straight to Union Square, so really easy to start getting about! Only negative is the parking is $20 per 24 hours, and there isn't always a space. There is another car park a block away for $16 per 24hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel with Unique Style”
Reviews.Author: NoBordersFilm
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Tomo many times over the last 8 years and each time it has been a very pleasant experience. The hotel is well maintained, the staff are friendly and the anime-style is unique. If you are looking for a modestly priced place to stay near Japantown, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “I was hoping for more”
Reviews.Author: sirtravel
Reviews.Content: I like staying in Japantown -- good restaurants, street parking, safe neighborhood -- and was looking forward to this stay, but the hotel was just OK. The Best Western branding caused me some concern since my experience with BW is that their is a lot of variance between properties, but the "Joie de Vivre" co-branding made me think it would be better than your typical BW hotel. And while it was better than your typical BW chain hotel, it was not as good as I would expect from "Joie de Vivre". My room was on the first floor -- same floor as the restaurant -- and it smelled like food all day. So I would recommend avoiding any room on this level. The room was very large, the quality of bedding OK, and the toiletries one level above budget hotel standards. The lobby was sparse but I did not expect much more. The hotel had all the necessary amenities in the room -- tea pot, ironing board, room safe, and small fridge, but the furniture was all institutional and felt more like a nice dorm room than a nice hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Style, comfort and value in the heart of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Judesmom45
Reviews.Content: We live only 20 miles from San Francisco, but often prefer to stay in a hotel in the City after an evening or two on the town. I found Hotel Tomo through the Best Western Rewards site and chose it for our New Year's Eve stay. What a delight to find a centrally located, first rate hotel with all the amenities, and really large, comfortable rooms, at a great price! Love the Japanese Anime style and the uniqueness of every guest room. We returned again with visiting family members in February, and found the same great, courteous service as we had experienced on our previous visit. I believe we have found "our" San Francisco hotel and plan to return again and again. If you want more bang for your buck, I feel confident in recommending the Hotel Tomo to anyone lucky enough to be visiting the City by the Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Traveler Value”
Reviews.Author: mutelorelei
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as a cheap value to attend a convention at the Moscone Center. You can't beat the price for such a central location. It's not far away from Moscone by bus (4 bucks RT) or taxi (18 bucks RT), and I feel more comfortable here walking around at night, and there's a lot of cheap food options nearby. Hotel Tomo is a little dated, but it was cleaner than many hotels I've stayed at. The rooms have a large college dorm feel, lots of utilitarian IKEA-type furniture. Bath is clearly old, but clean. Toilet did not flush well. Incredibly minimal bath light, and toiletries provided are cheap, I was glad I brought my own. My bed was pretty comfortable overall, pillows a little too soft for my taste. I could not hear traffic noise, but when I slept in one morning I could clearly hear loud children from somewhere nearby (either daycare or school). I could hear other rooms as well, I had some loud neighbors that felt like slamming doors and stomping loudly in the middle of the night, which kept waking me up. But I could not hear normal, low-noise activity from other rooms, or much from the maids, so the walls aren't totally paper-thin. Free Wi-Fi, no password required, is provided but is extremely slow. There is a small fridge in the room, and a small room safe, both of which can be locked. The TV in my room did not work well and did not seem to have all the advertised channels, but I wasn't really that interested in it, so I didn't care all that much personally. The staff is very polite and call you every evening to ask if you have problems. I am satisfied overall.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: Anya555
Reviews.Content: Tomo is located in Japancenter - the Japanese mall full of Japanese restaurants, shops, services. A real piece of Tokyo in San Francisco. The location is not well know in most visitors are Japanse, making a good difference. The rooms are big, we had two queen beds, the garage is accomodating, the staff is nice. The value is wonderfull! While the tap in the bath took some getting used to, the water was strong and hot and the bath big enough for a soak. For the price - best value in San Francisco. Especially if you like Japanese food. And do try the Isobune sushi in the mall.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Very Good Service.”
Reviews.Author: dhknhall
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights (2-20 to 2-22). The hotel is conveniently located in Japantown. Very Close to the Japantown mall. Just a short drive or muni ride to Golden Gate Park, the wharf, and dowtown. The rooms may be a bit outdated (but I understand they are renovating all the rooms), however the room was very clean. The first night of our stay we attempted to watch a pay movie. The Lodgenet system would not work. The hotel staff attempted to correct the problem but could not. We were offered another room for the night. We were tired from our day in SF so we decided to stay the night in the room. The next day the hotel staff was unable to fix the Lodgenet system in the room. The hotel manager (I apologize but I can not remember her name), was very gracious and gave us another room. We will stay here again I'm sure.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with average service which is looking a little worn.”
Reviews.Author: bixatthebeach
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in Japantown. I found the hotel pretty average and a little worn. The rooms were not quiet. We could hear everything from the room next door. The staff were a little still, not super friendly. I thought it was overpriced for the value.

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem in Japantown”
Reviews.Author: dawalker05
Reviews.Content: Stayed in San Francisco for 5 days at this hotel. I was very impressed with the service and the cleanliness. The Front Office Manager was great. I had a problem with my shower and she came to the room with her tools and repaired. The place is very clean and smells good. I was worried about staying there but this is a real gem. You can stay here and cab everywhere. With a tip it is less than $10 to downtown. To the Castro it is about $12. I walked to the Fishermans Wharf which is a wonderful walk but took the Cable car to downtown and then back to the hotel. They stored my luggage at check out and made arrangements for my return to the airport. COngratulations on a great staff and a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at best... My advice: look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Traveler14698
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in December 2010. Overall, it is a decent budget hotel, but with a few key flaws. Personally, I will not come back here again. Pros: - decent size rooms for an OK price (~100-120 per night); - the hotel can accommodate 4 people, so it may be good for families with kids; - small fridge in the room. Cons: - location. The hotel is in a pretty safe area, BUT it is about 1-3 miles from any place you would want to be. If you are disinclined to walk for half and hour to an hour to the spot you actually want to walk through, you're stuck taking 2-3 buses each way. Munis are good (run every 10-15 minutes normally), but by the end of the trip I got sick and tired of taking buses everywhere. There are hotels in about the same price range in MUCH better locations. - Wifi (free in-room) is horrendous. My e-mail took 1-2 minutes to load. Most websites didn't load at all. A few other guests I chatted with had the same problem. Ethernet was only a touch faster. In this day and age, having such slow internet is inexcusable. I travel a lot and this is by far the worst connection I ever had to use. Other issues: - the hotel is tired, everything is well worn and / or dirty. The pillowcases were torn in several places. The sheets were slightly stained and worn through from the wear. The mattress covers... don't get me started. - decor: I know they're going for something hip and original. Unfortunately, the decor comes off silly and ugly. The rooms are dark. the bathroom light is so dim you can barely see anything. The toilet and bathtub/shower is separated from the sink (makes for filthy door handles). The whole thing - a turn off, though personally not a deal breaker. - customer service (lack thereof) and security. I do not appreciate a friend of mine being able to get a new key to my room without even showing id. Pretty much anyone off the street could get access to my room. The next time he tried, he was asked for id. But consistency in security policies is essential. Overall, my trip was decent, but I will definitely stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: holymilo
Reviews.Content: Funny how paint and a good concept can make a Best Western seem like something else. Normally we stay in the Union Square area of SF but Japan town was a pleasant change. We were in San Francisco to have a procedure done at Mt. Zion UCSF. This hotels' location was perfect. A 6 block walk to the medical center. Great food within walking distance and fun shopping at the oragami and hardware store.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless, cute, quirky, a nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: mikebern
Reviews.Content: I didn't really have high expectations for this place, and the entrance and the lobby are nothing to write home about. However, the staff was as welcoming and friendly as can be, and the room was comfortable and unbelievably clean. Even the bed cover smelled fresh and good (and we all know most hotels never wash these.) On the wall was a really sweet mural of a deer in the forest which brought another unexpected element to the experience. It's also relatively easy to park on the street around here...and the hotel garage is not too expensive. The complimentary wireless Internet also worked quite well. It is also in walking distance of several Fillmore Street clubs and they seem to be the hotel that puts up the musicians when they play at Yoshi's (which I would highly recommend too!) The only negatives: a badly malfunctioning shower head & very poor water pressure (on the 3rd floor, and since my room had an adjoining room option with the next room, it was very easy to hear my neighbors having loud sex involving spanking, which might have been amusing if I wasn't so exhausted and in need of sleep.)

Reviews.Title: “Interesting”
Reviews.Author: rdub7
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in this funky hotel. Japanese Pop theme. The hotel staff very friendly. The price was reasonable. Wish we had more time to spend and explore the area.

Reviews.Title: “Really cool hotel in great area”
Reviews.Author: Redcat290
Reviews.Content: Really great decor, loved it - cool murals on the walls. Close to the Japan Centre which has lots of brilliant places to eat. Close to lots of Muni stops and it's not too far to walk to some good bars in the Civic Centre area. Would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, cool room decor, nice neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: OllyJackson
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and thought it was really nice. Nicely located in quiet Japantown, close to bus links to downtown and over the road from the Japantown mall (great random shops and takeaway food). Rooms have a vaguely japanese pop art mural on one wall. The rest of the room was nicely neutral with beige and light wood. Really spacious, with a massive, comfortable bed. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: Allison67
Reviews.Content: Fun hotel in a really great and safe neighborhood! Friendly staff and adequate rooms... great little restaurants and shops within walking distance. Easy taxi ride to all tourist attractions and the staff was happy to call a cab for us. Great restaurants close by include: Florio, The Wine Jar, Fillmore Bakery and the Japantown mall has lots of great options. We would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Best of both worlds”
Reviews.Author: Devon_Brooklyn_NY
Reviews.Content: I was in San Francisco for a conference at another hotel, but couldn't get a room there for a second night. This hotel was the closest I could find to the conference hall and I loved it. I had thought a best western would be nice enough, but kind of generic, but this is actually a boutique hotel. The decor was stylish with fun artwork on the walls, the beds were comfortable and the staff at the front desk was very friendly and helpful. I had never been in Japan Town before and I can't believe what I've been missing out on all these years. It's got some cool shops, restaurants and bars nearby and it's only a short cab ride or a 15-minute walk to Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “A most enjoyable and excellent value hotel in San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: Neil97
Reviews.Content: As a family with young children, we found everything to be fine with this hotel. The room was airy and pleasant, beds comfortable and better still, it was quiet - all night! The breakfast was good and basement car parking very convenient. We found that it was quite easy to walk downtown from this location and we are very pleased that we chose this location rather than other more clustered settings. Thanks also to front office manager Gill for her good humour and helpfulness.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable stay a bit out of the centre”
Reviews.Author: Jeanetteflowers
Reviews.Content: Quite a nice hotel in Japanese style. Very lary murals on bedroom walls! Need to either have transport or negotiate buses and cable cars as out of centre of town but can be good as you see all the bits you might miss if in staying Fishermans Wharf area. Easy bus reach of Union Square. Comfortable but no frills. Very quiet area so no disturbed sleep dooesn't feel like you are in the middle of busy city.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, smart hotel and good value, just a little out of the way...”
Reviews.Author: Drop_n_Bear
Reviews.Content: Had a really nice 3 night stay here, clean large rooms with trendy styling, lift/vending machine could be heard through the doors, but on the whole fantastic value for an expensive city like San Fran. Beds were comfy, staff (mostly) helpful and on-site "Shabu Shabu" was very good for the money. No breakfast included in the rate, but not a massive problem in a big city where you want to try other places! Good free wi-fi and decent sized flat screen TV If you can find for anywhere near £60-70 (say about $100) per night it's great value. The only problem we had was it was a little way from "Down Town" or the Pier/Wharf areas, a taxi cost about $15 one way, and although near by bus routes were useful, San Fran public transport can be a little daunting for the out-of-towners.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable rooms !!”
Reviews.Author: Rajjake
Reviews.Content: Great location and a peaceful neighbourhood. Right in the middle of Japan Town. Walking distance to many local attractions and very accessible to public transportation. The staff at the reception were very helpful. Nice spacious rooms and comfortably furnished. Great deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: HAZYL
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. Booked because of the good price I got ($90CA+tax per night) on Expedia, reasonable location, and the overwhelmingly positive reviews. On the positive side the room was nice and clean, recently renovated, the bed comfortable (we slept very well), the bathroom clean. The decor is cheery. We were on the top floor and could not hear any noise from neighbors. The location is reasonable, as long as you can stomach (or avoid) Filmore street where there is obvious poverty and it looks like a rough area, and as long as you don't mind asian food, since there is not much else in the immediate vicinity (except for Filmore St). There is a large IGA at 5 minutes walk where you can stock up on stuff for breakfast and right next to it there is also a laundromat. On the negative side, the windows are old (original) single pane, sliding, with metallic frame. Ours was facing west so there was quite a bit of heat gain, even with the curtains closed. The air conditioning does not work, regardless of the setting of the thermostat in the room, until someone complains to the front desk staff. Then, they turn it on. The official spin is that it needs to be "reset". I think management is just trying to save on electricity costs and they turn it way down for the whole building. We complained every single night, and like magic, the A/C started working. Overall, we got what we payed for: a clean room with a good sleep. There is a restaurant but we found it pricey for Japantown and ate somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: stretch418
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights last fall. Got a deal through Travelzoo and only paid $79 a night. For that price in the city I could not be happier. The room bed hotel everything was average but for the price I was paying I was very happy. The hotel is in Japantown away from the heart of the city, but close to mass transit. I personally liked staying a little off the beaten path.

Reviews.Title: “OK for price”
Reviews.Author: Frimeur
Reviews.Content: I stayed in May. I was in town for a job interview. the price was excellent for value, received and the location, next to Japantown, was convenient. The hotel was a bit 'echo-y' in the halls, and the rooms often had doors between them, but I had no trouble sleeping. And , again, for the price it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Hotel Tomo”
Reviews.Author: NGM1976
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in Japentown which is a little out the way although the bus stop is close by. We were happy to walk everywhere and explore the city on foot so was not a problem. Reasonable rates for SF and taxi fare from SFO was $40 ish. The rooms are modern and interesting. Reception very efficient. Quiet at night which was very welcome after sightseeing all day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Economy_Class_Clive
Reviews.Content: We (family of 4) stayed in Hotel Tomo for 3 nights in August 2010. This is a very nice hotel. Our room was big enough for all 4 of us. It was clean, had a fridge and everything worked - the alarm clock even had an iPod dock, which impressed my children !! We didn't try the restaurant so can't comment on that. The staff were friendly and helpful. The parking lot is small and was full when we arrived so we checked in and then were directed to a large underground lot a block away in Japantown. This was fine and charged $16 a day to park. To be honest, parking is such a nightmare in the touristy areas of SF you really don't need a car. We just left the car in the parking lot and used buses and trams for 3 days on a Muni travel card ($20 for 3 days). There are 2 bus routes right outside the door of the hotel (2 and 3) and these get to union square / market street in about 10 minutes and cost $2 one way for adults and 25c for children. There was free WI-FI in the rooms and 2 free internet-enabled computers in the lobby. The area was quiet and felt safe even at night. There are several small shops just a couple of blocks up the road. We liked this hotel and would recommend it. Just one warning for first time visitors to SF in August - it's cold and often foggy, bring your coat. We came from Yosemite and the temperature drop was a real shock at first.

Reviews.Title: “Beaut little hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: CharlesAndCompany
Reviews.Content: This is a cute little hotel in the Japantown area of Frisco. The staff were super helpful. The decor in the rooms might be a little overpowering for some but the four of us ( all in our 50's & 60's) didn't have a problem with it. The Hotel is on the bus route into the Frisco CBD and it was so convenient to be able to just jump on a bus to get into town. No need for a car in this town, the public transport system is great. The room was a little small but it had all we needed. There was a balcony that allowed us to gaze over the rooftops and sometimes catch a glimpse of blue sky through the fog.
