We loved this little hotel and its atmosphere. We will certainly book here again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice supprise!”
Reviews.Author: Loztastic
Reviews.Content: This was a really pleasant hotel. Clearly an old-school bland hotel, that had been given a massive makeover, fulling it with kitch manga-style/J-pop decor. Free internet access, including a printer great location - out of the chaos of the centre, in a really nice area, but with easy access to town only down-sides were the hotel resteraunts being average at best, and some initial confusion over our booking of a room with bed and breakfast (which the hotel didn't offer - I blame expedia, not the hotel), There were plenty of high-quality cafe's close by, though!

Reviews.Title: “A fun neighborhood experience”
Reviews.Author: SMKKD
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three days at the Hotel Tomo. We usually stay in the luxury hotels downtown but this time wanted a more neighborhood experience. This fit the bill. The hotel was clean and rooms were sufficeint. There were no frills, but we spent very little time in our room, so why pay for things you don't use. This hotel is two blocks from Fillmore street where there are a lot of great restaurants and shops. It is situated in Japantown which had some interesting shops and restaurants, but would not be considered a destination. The mainline bus stop was across the street so it made for a good base. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Overall; clean, a great value, relaxing sleep. Will go back.”
Reviews.Author: seemac70
Reviews.Content: This a revamped, older hotel. As the photos suggest, it is very bright, and to me, novel and cheerful. Very central location, almost in the "centre" of San Francisco. (Japantown, Upper Fillmore.) Great access to transit, as in right outside the front doors. Taxis were always there as well. Mere minutes to the hustle and bustle of Union Square, or most anyplace, really. Fine by me. Very quiet at night, and very safe. We walked quite a bit also, as it was fun to check out the town on foot. Snacks and booze are handy, too. Always a plus. Try the BevMo on Van Ness. Had breakfast one morning at the restaurant. Not bad, not great. It got the job done just fine. Shabu is their main thing, anyways. We got a great rate, but we were on the second floor and in a room that had been pretty well worn in, a touch of shabby, if you will, with the bright colours only making this a little more obvious. Towels, too, were pretty threadbare, but tolerable. I didn't steal any, that's for sure. I kind of expect this in a hotel of this kind... This is my only compliant, as the linens were spotless and crisp. Overall cleanliness was fine. Beds just right. I'm not looking for luxury and pampering in a joint like this, and as such, it was perfect in that regard. Staff were professional and answered all queries. Hotel Tomo was a very functional home base for seeing a truly fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: TravelTheWest
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a good compromise between still being rather central without paying a high price. The room was clean and big but simple. All main attractions can be reached by walking (only for trained people) and public transportations. The hotel is located in one of the nicest neighborhoods of San Francisco and definitely something for people who like to experience more than just the touristic life of a city. Good cafes and delis are around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Good but I thought too expensive”
Reviews.Author: Wildman_Aussie
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was extremely expensive but being first time in San francisco cannot really compare. The hotel staff were very friendly and although the mexican waiter in the restaurant had a rough start in the customer service department pulled through in the end! Breakfast was pretty good value! Rooms are very clean and modern. Wifi and also a LAN port in room was good. Right on the bus line so very handy to public transport. Travel advice. Get an all day pass which covers buses and also the cable car. It is very easy to get around town by public transport. After you have done cable car it is probably cheaper just to but fares individually for the bus. I think you can use connecting buses with same ticket!

Reviews.Title: “Good option outside Union”
Reviews.Author: RutabegaSaranwrap
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in San Francisco two times right in Union square. This time around we wanted to have a larger room in a quiter location. I found the hotel tomo on trip advisor and the reviews and photos seemed to be pretty good. On the plus side, we had the largest room out of all our hotels. It was nice to have two queen beds and space for a family of 3 with an 11 year old. Our daughter loved the japanese theme of the hotel and room. The wall mural was cool and we had a balcony which was really nice, great views. The room itself is updated but was a little dirty. The carpets are light coloured and they look stained. The plastic chair at the desk needed to be cleaned but the rest of the room seemed pretty clean. The beds were clean but very firm, I did not have the greatest sleep, I like my bed a little softer. The shower area was too dark and the tile was a little dirty. It was great to be near Fillmore street. Lots of goodshops and The Grove for breakfast was awesome. We really wanted to go to the Japanese spa around the corner (Tuesday's are co-ed and bathing suit required) but it was closed for cleaning which was dissapointing. My daughter loved getting japanese candies from the little store across the street from the hotel. The neighbourhood is quiet and safe, a nice change from Union Square. It was easy to hop on the bus from there and get to Union or Fisherman's wharf. The buses are much quicker and less busy that than street cars/trolleys and run frequently. We had a fridge in the room which is also nice for water and snacks. Parking on site was convenient and much cheaper than Union. Staff was helpful and friendly. Overall, good value for San Francisco but I think I still prefer being closer to Union. More choices for restaurants and transit.

Reviews.Title: “Different in a good way.”
Reviews.Author: Nicole060
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and creatively decorated, the staff was knowledgeable and friendly. I would definitely stay here again. I recommend going over to the Japantown Mall which is one block south of the hotel on post street. Its a very small mall that has excellent Crepes with ice cream, its all the way at the back of the mall next to the book store. :)

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return again.”
Reviews.Author: 19Zoll
Reviews.Content: Tasteful, modern rooms with good Internet infrastructure. Nothing missing. Reception: partly very friendly, partly below average. A pity that the breakfast was not included.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in SF.”
Reviews.Author: bearhug973
Reviews.Content: Hotel Tomo is opposite to Japantown. This is practical. And there is a bus stop next to it. The room is original with a manga painted wall and some japanese inspiration for the furniture. The room and beds were huge. It was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: ibujawa
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel since we want to have a new stay experience (at first, we were attracted by the room decor :p )..and we love it! It's an urban, a green room with free internet too..The staffs were very helpful and knowledgeable about the city, the hotel location is on Sutter street, which was a nice and quiet place very near to Japantown but also within a decent distance with most popular areas like Union square, Fisherman Wharf or Alcatraz.. We went to the hotel from SFO using BART, you can stop at powell/civic station and then take MUNI bus no.2 or 3 which will stop very near to Tomo. We also got a very great deal staying here, hence our first touchdown in San Francisco were really memorable.. :) I recommend this place to everyone :)

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: TNtraveler2242
Reviews.Content: Was a great choice for us. Close enough to all the attractions, but far enough away from the center of town to be quiet at night and for everyone to feel safe. Not an elegant motel, but a good deal for the money in this area. My only complaint is the platform beds were a litttle hard and some nights it was difficult to get the room cool enough. Extremely clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, Nicely furnished and Safe Area”
Reviews.Author: travelwhere
Reviews.Content: The reason that I choose this hotel was because it had good reviews and was fairly close to UCSF. My 12 y/o grandson had an early morning procedure and could be nearby after it that evening. His family had one room and my 15 y/o grandson and I had another room. It seemed difficult to find San Francisco hotel rooms that had 2 beds. Not at the Tomo! We would highly recommend this place if you are interested in Japantown or need to be close to UCSF. The rooms were nicely furnished and decorated. Everything was well maintained and modern looking. Our room had a bean bag chair, which my grandson enjoyed. The bathroom was spotless in every way. The area felt very safe for walking around outside, which may not always be the case in San Francisco. The price was very reasonable. Union square is nearby by bus. My grandson wanted pizza and we found it 2 blocks down. We rode the BART in from Dublin/Pleasanton and rode the Muni around town. It was a great way to get around and not have to be concerned about parking or driving. The day we left the hotel, my 15 y/o grandson and I went on the Electric Tour Company Segway tour and would highly recommend it. Then we went to the Alcatraz tour, which was great, too. I had not done the grounds tour before and it was so nice to look out at the Golden Gate from another view. The hour long audio tour is very well done, too. We asked our Segway tour operator if she would recommend any hotels near the Wharf and she stated, "no, too touristy." If I went back, I may just be willing to stay outside the wharf tourist area and get much more value for my money at the Tomo. The bus ride was nothing to complain about for us.....

Reviews.Title: “Not the usual uniform dull hotel”
Reviews.Author: rtussin
Reviews.Content: Situated near a Japantown square complete with cherry blossom trees and pagoda type building- different and beautiful. Inside the themed rooms were very popular with my daughter who loves Japanese anime and cartoons.. Staff great- in house cafe not to our taste though. Good too, to be away from main tourist area but still on a bus route that makes the whole city accessible. Also 15 mins walk up the hill to a great kids park with great views.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Service”
Reviews.Author: Alban_Marion
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights. We had a broken idock and they changed it in the afternoon. The hotel is well located (2 buses to join Union Sqaure in 10 minutes), near from the Japan center (lots of restaurants). For those who want to buy foods, there is a Safeway.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Tomo- charming refuge from the typical SFO hotel”
Reviews.Author: SLSmart
Reviews.Content: Just like in the pictures, a charming, modern rendition of Japanese pop culture. Great wall art in the rooms. Simple design. Clean and vibrant. The rooms overlook the streets of Pacific Heights/ Japantown, quiet and respectful neighborhood. There is sushi within walking distance (everywhere). Short walk to Fillmore Street and the Sundance Cinema. The staff here was cool cool (yes 2 thumbs up - so 2 "cool" call-outs) and even honored the fare I saw online even though I had reserved under another(higher) fare, just to secure the room beforehand. Top notch. Oh! Free Wifi, and there's a rad beanbag chair where I could watch my flat plasma. Good stuff and not overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Neat little place but parking is sparse”
Reviews.Author: DT808
Reviews.Content: Found this on hotels.com as being close to USF. The room included 2 queen beds. We were put on the 1st floor (which is upstairs), which floor also contains the restaurant. Our room was noisy in the daytime, as it was across the employee lounge (room 101), but it was quiet in the evening. Didn't have much of a chance to enjoy Japan Town which would make this location ideal. Wished that the cable cars were closer. Beware - their parking below the hotel was sparse. When we returned in the evening, it was coned "full" but we ran it and had the front desk open the gate and we found a couple of empty stalls. Overall, the price was right and i would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Tomo Hotel was perfect for our needs.”
Reviews.Author: Art_lover96
Reviews.Content: My husband recently stayed a week at the Tomo while our son underwent surgery. We picked the hotel first for location it was very convenient for walking to our son's apartment. Secondly I chose the hotel for its fun decor-Japanese anime designs. It was also somewhat less expensive compared to another hotel nearby. The hotel staff were wonderful. The accommodations were more than adequate for needs including in-room refrigerators. The only thing we missed was an in-room coffee pot although we did not check to see if one could have been provided. As a happy coincidence the annual Cherry Blossom Festival was at our door which was great. We look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: NextDestination77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in Japantown, very close to the UCSF Cancer Center. The rooms are very clean, with comfortable beds, a desk/workstation, and free WIFI in your room. The staff was very helpful and courteous. There is parking below the hotel for $20 per day. The room was a great deal for the inexpensive price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: amandamay30
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at this funky and fun place for two nights in March 2010. We had a great room, I wish I could remember the number. Anyway, the decor was fun, the location was great (about a $10 cab ride including tip to the major city fun spots) and best of all the staff was super friendly and the room was clean. It was a pretty quiet street with a bus stop just up the block if I remember correctly. All in all, Tomo was a great stay for us!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in Japan Town”
Reviews.Author: time2travelsfo
Reviews.Content: We were at this hotel for a reception / party held on the patio. It is in an excellent location with shops, restaurants and theaters right in the heart of Japan Town. The rooms are bright, modern and clean. It has a fun theme with Manga and Anime decorations. The rooms also featured Flat Screen LCD TVs. Computer and printer available in the lobby. We would definately recommend Hotel Tomo. Our experience was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel: Great Value”
Reviews.Author: mahaloboy
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel for value, cleanliness, and comfort. It is located in Japan town and a bit away from the main attractions. No complains. Hotels closer to the main attraction had either bad reviews, too expensive, or had expensive parking fees. I was concerned about bed bugs in high traffic hotels and street noise, and this hotel alleviated my concerns. Their double bed rooms had queen size beds, and the rooms were spacious. It was what I was looking for since we were traveling with two teenagers. The hotel was newly renovated with clean carpets. Japan Center with its shops and affordable restaurants across the street made dining very easy. It had limited parking spaces but you can park at Japan center for less but no in and out privileges. There were two bus lines, one in front of the hotel and the other a few blocks down on Geary Street that takes you downtown. They also had a computer and printer so you can print out your return boarding passes!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Tomo”
Reviews.Author: wildwood_m
Reviews.Content: Hotel Tomo was a total pleasure. The staff were friendly and helpful. We had a room with two queens, balcony and view on the 8th floor. It was quiet, roomy, clean and very comfortable for a great price. We joined The JDV and got a small bottle of red wine on arrival. Very tasty. We enjoyed spending time in our room at the Tomo and coming back to it at the end of the day. It had a small fridge and a safe which were both very useful. We really liked the clean decor and the bright colors. It had free local calls. We used the iron and ironing board. We used the free wired and wireless internet.a lot. We enjoyed the free USA Today. We used the kettle to make tea. The area is very nice and quiet and felt safe but only a short bus ride to the city center. When compared to places we have stayed in the city center it is definitely worth the bus trip. We shopped at the Japanese mall and found a number of nice Japanese gifts. We had dinner once at one of the Japanese restaurants in the mall. The food was really good and different than what we get at home in Vancouver. We also ate at the Dosa restaurant that is a short walk away on Fillmore and Post which was good as well. We stayed at the Mosser the last night in San Francisco and found our room to be small, internet $10 per day extra, no safe, no fridge, much noisier of course due to the location and we paid much more than at the Tomo. We will go to the Tomo again next time we go to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet and Roomy in Japan Town”
Reviews.Author: MrsColtrane
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the centre of Japan town. We took a room on one of the higher floors with a balcony which was a great choice and we loved the view. Our room was very very clean, had free wifi internet and a wonderful anime mural. Outside there are muni busses which take you straight into the centre of town and there are lots of Japanese restaurants and shops just across the street. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Oh so comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: vilmitaHawaii
Reviews.Content: Hotel Tomo is clean, comfortable and wonderfully located in Japantown. The service was excellent with friendly and caring staff, clean and feathery soft beds and pillows, large comfy rooms. The area is extremely quiet! The neighborhood feels safe, is close to transportation and yummy restaurants. We will stay here every time we come into the city.

Reviews.Title: “Cool JPop Hotel in a great area”
Reviews.Author: ds23pallas
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel Tomo because of the style portrayed on it's website. Everything in the hotel is styled in a J-Pop fashion. The foyer had Japanese arcade machines and a giant inflatable Maneki-Neko. Each room is individually styled with manga-style artwork on the walls. Our room was very very clean and excellently styled. We had a huge Fatboy beanbag to relax on and the bed was large and comfortable. Being in a downtown area of SF I was concerned that it might be noisy in the night but in actual fact it was very quiet so we got a good nights sleep. The temperture was fine (AC + heat) and the room was really dark with the curtains drawn. The hotel is located just across from Japancentre in the Japantown area. We felt safe walking the streets and didn't encounter any beggars as is common is SF. The shops in Japancentre are well worth a look, we could have spent a fortune! Japantown of course also has plenty of sushi restaurants. Union Square is a short ride on the Muni bus, which stops just outside of the hotel and costs $2. Hotel Tomo is highly recommended, very very clean, comfortable and well decorated. The only tiny (and I mean tiny) complaint I had is that our iPod alarm clock was missing the connector for big iPods like mine, but since I didn't use the alarm this is barely worth mentioning. The hotel has a car-park attached, parking was $20 for a night. I didn't see any valet, it all seemed self-park. There is a restaurant/bar in the hotel but we only tried breakfast, which we had a choice of either Japanese or traditional American. Being vegetarian we had each had two-eggs, which were fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: AKNault
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel for many reasons, but the most obvious to me is that Japantown is the hidden gem of San Francisco and the hotel represents the quiet enjoyment of the neighbourhood. The room was clean and quiet, and the staff were flexible and available when needed.

Reviews.Title: “Can A Hotel Be Fun?”
Reviews.Author: SanCarlosGuy
Reviews.Content: Hotel Tomo isn't a great hotel, but it is a fun one. It's a well priced and managed dressed up Best Western. I requested and received a top floor, balcony with a view room. The room size and closets/dresser drawers were good for 1-2 adults or possibly a family with younger children. The J-Pop decor is just as described on the Best Western and JDV websites. I'd recommend Hotel Tomo to visitors fairly familiar with the layout of SF. It's in a quiet, safe and very pretty neighborhood (Lower Pacific Heights). It's also near some very nice neighborhood restaurants two blocks away on Fillmore Street and Japantown is just across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Mello Yellow”
Reviews.Author: SantaCruzMonterey
Reviews.Content: When my wife said she found this hotel deal ... I expected the worst. Instead the place has a nice modern Japanese feel. Nice views of the city from the upper floors. Comfortable bed, flat screen TV and work space.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: cloudbrook
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Tomo in Japantown in San Fransisco following my sons surgery. It was a stressful time and the hotel was perfect for relaxing and recharging. The price was reasonable and the rooms were delightfully cheery. The decor was modern with pleasantly surprising splashes of color which immediately lifted my mood. The beds were comfortable, the room quiet. There is a restaurant and bar. The hotel is in a neat area of San Fransisco, immediately outside the front door is a Japanese plaza with a Pagoda and shops. It was great.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: AJ215
Reviews.Content: Going on the strength on the reviews that I'd read about Hotel Tomo and the kitsch factor of staying in a manga hotel, we booked a room for two nights. We were on the first floor which is shared by the shabu shabu restaurant which meant that our room did not smell great. The room mural was pretty cool and it was a fairly quiet hotel, so you don't have to worry about the noise here. To say it's a manga hotel is a bit much. To say it's a dressed-up, old Best Western would be right on the ball.

Reviews.Title: “This is our favorite place to stay in San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: OhioCav
Reviews.Content: Our 15-year old granddaughter is fascinated with Japanese culture; she loves the room decor. It is a five-minute walk to the Japan Center and wonderful shopping and restaurants. In ten minutes, we can be at Golden Gate Park or the Waterfront. The staff at the Hotel Tomo are very friendly and helpful. Parking is very limited in the Hotel Garage; I recommend parking at Japan Center instead. It is slightly cheaper and very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in great area--excellent for the money.”
Reviews.Author: let28
Reviews.Content: We just came back from SF where we stayed at Hotel Tomo. Couldn't recommend it enough. Great beds, clean and airy rooms; excellent manager who went out of her way to make sure we got a parking space at the hotel's parking garage every time-this was key to us since we have 6 and a 1 year-old kids. We loved breakfast on La Boulange on Filmmore st. The Pacific Heights are is great and just a few blocks from Hotel Tomo. Of course, some things could be improved--the carpet is getting run down and the noise the first night bothered us. But again, this is SF, and we paid a little over 100 dollars a night. All in all, great neighborhood, friendly and helpful staff, clean hotel with excellent beds and shower + very cool place. If in SF again, I would for sure go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel in peaceful location with great views and best duvets.”
Reviews.Author: TheJillahs
Reviews.Content: HOTEL TOMO! It makes you want to shout the name in a Japanese style. This is a kitsch pop-arty style hotel in the Japantown part of San Francisco. We loved this hotel because it was different. We went for the second part of our honeymoon, and there was a congrats card and a bottle of sake waiting for us in our room. We arrived early, but they let us in straight away. In the room, everything was trendy, from the white flat-screen TV, to the mural on the wall, to the giant fat-boy bean bag to the floor-to-ceiling windows looking over Japantown. It's a nice area, away from the tourisity bits, so this is good to see the 'real' San Francisco. And Japantown is cool, there is a quiet indoor shopping centre full of Japanese shops and restaurants - it feels as if you are actually in Japan. Great for buying all those kitsch bits and pieces for the home. And it's only a bus ride away or a half-hour walk to the main shopping district. And if you are walking to the shopping district, there's a friendly sports bar on the way where you can stop off, have a drink and watch English football. They even let you bring in food from the Mexican across the road and they did GOOD burritos. Only downfall of the hotel was that the bathroom was a bit small and minimalist, but that would be expected for the bargain price. And where was our cuddly toy that was advertised in their pictures?? Upon leaving, they booked us an executive llimosine to go to the airport, which was the same price as a cab. Very good!

Reviews.Title: “highly affordable; highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: alstrock
Reviews.Content: I went to SF to have surgery, and chose Hotel Tomo because: 1. it looked fun & fresh 2. it was cheap 3. it was close to my surgery center. The rooms were exactly as expected, but the customer service was outstanding. A very hospitable stay!!! We had a few minor issues. We requested an ADA room when we got there, and they were more than happy to accommodate. Turns out I didn't end up using one. Our TV in the room was broken, and they replaced it immediately. Also the day of surgery, they saw me hobbling in, and offered an office chair to my boyfriend so he could wheel me down my long hallway. Great folks & a great place!

Reviews.Title: “Eerie atmosphere, Space Odyssey in yellow”
Reviews.Author: indian_skies
Reviews.Content: The place is clean, has a clinical feel to it, in a very quiet part of the city. I arrived late so ate at the restaurant (Mum's) in the hotel - now there was really rude service. The person who waited on me didn't look at me, wouldn't say anything and they couldn't wait to get me out of there. The food was below average although I had read reviews that this is a popular restaurant. I am widely travelled and have stayed in hotels all over the world. My three-night stint in San Francisco was at the end of 6 weeks of travelling, staying in hotels ranging from budget to high end. If you came to the city for peace and quiet then this is the place. The corridors are stark, lifeless and it feels like a lab. As for the restaurant, if you are like me, an Indian woman travelling on her own don't go there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for a Clean, Well Managed hotel”
Reviews.Author: Meli2009
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. We had been to Japantown on a previous trip and remembered the area as being a quiet neighborhood and close enough to all the places we wanted to visit and that still holds true today. The staff was pleasant and very helpful whether it was giving us directions around town or helping us with directions to Yosemite at 4:30 am(Bay Bridge was closed). The hotel is right by the Bart line so that makes it very convenient. The hotel also offers garage parking for $20 a day which is very reasonable in the city. We used both our car and the Bart since parking around town can be tricky. It's a hip hotel which fulfilled all the criteria for our family: clean,comfy, safe, reasonably priced. Housekeeping did a very nice job cleaning and being on top of things. I accidentally pulled one side of the towel rack out of the wall by pulling too hard. We didn't have time to call to the front desk to notify them of the towel rack, but by the time we got back to the room later that day, it was all clean and the towel rack had been fixed. We were impressed with this hotel and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “good for value and location”
Reviews.Author: travelwork
Reviews.Content: Had a 4 night stay in S.F. and was looking for good value in a quiet location, and I couldn't have made a better choice. Not only was the hotel really clean and quiet as I wanted, but it was also right around the corner from Fillmore Street and Pacific Heights and Cow Hollow areas, which are really great to walk around in and for great boutiques and cafes and restaurants. The front desk staff were a little hit or miss, some were really nice and knew lots of good information, others were kind of clueless. But there were enough helpful ones to overlook the ones who weren't that great. My room had a king bed and a nice view with a window seat. There is a reasonable fitness center with equipment in good shape. Across the street are three bus lines that run downtown and right around the hotel are more bus stops to go other places in the city - very easy to get around on public transportation or on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday trip”
Reviews.Author: cyrina116
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really cute! It's japanese culture themed and is right across the street from Japan town in San Francisco. The hotel staff was very nice and our room was kitschy. It had kind of an anime-esque mural on the wall and the furniture was modern and cute. the restaurant in the lobby was yummy and served a traditional japanese breakfast. They also served shabu shabu for dinner. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: sftraveler15
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have traveled to S.F. serveral times this past year. We just happened to find hotel Tomo by accident. We have both said we would never stay anywhere else. We love the location, Japan town is right at your front door. All the shopping and restauraunts you could want. The Fillmore is also a hop skip and a jump. They have excellent bars, and shops as well. What i really like about Hotel Tomo is the staff. They are always friendly and are genuinely interested in making your stay a good one. They even remember me when i call to make my reservation. I reccomend Tomo to all my friends who are going to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Hip decor, comfy and clean”
Reviews.Author: NCALGAL
Reviews.Content: Spent the night at the Hotel Tomo while attending a function in San Francisco. The price was right, the beds were comfortable and the rooms were immaculate. I loved the flat screen tv, the excellent wireless connection even from the 8th floor. Our room had a balcony facing east with an excellent view. The staff was very welcoming and helpful, the housekeeping staff never failed to greet us and we were lucky to snag one of the onsite parking spots. Hotel Tomo is close to the Fillmore street nightlife and a short drive to downtown SF or the wharf. It was quiet and relaxing, much more of a residential area than a business district. The onsite restaurant served a decent breakfast with a bottomless coffee pot of excellent coffee, what more can you ask for? I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot in Japantown”
Reviews.Author: takehikes
Reviews.Content: We only spent one night but the hotel was very nice, quiet and clean. It is within blocks of both Yoshi's and the Fillmore so no need for a car. Japantown is so quiet it's like it's not part of SF. Really enjoyed our stay and will return.

Reviews.Title: “I loved the Hotel Tomo!”
Reviews.Author: starlight14
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Tomo in October 2009. The location was great - just a short walk to Fillmore street and shops and restaurants. The decor is fun- Japanese pop art meets Ikea. This was probably the cleanest hotel I have ever stayed in. The murals on the walls are awesome. The beds and pillows are super comfortable. The front desk staff were very helpful. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, pleasant and clean”
Reviews.Author: Alanmelon
Reviews.Content: The Japanese themed Hotel Tomo has great decor and really quirky touches to all parts of the hotel, from the lucky cat in the lobby to the feature mural on the wall of each room, which were a very generous size. Everything was clean and well maintained and the bed was huge, although the bathroom was very basic. Nice added touches included an ipod dock and giant bean bag. Free wifi and internet access in the hotel lobby proved very useful, although an extension of the wifi to the bedrooms would have been appreciated. The staff were knowledgeable, competent and polite if a little unfriendly, and could only provide very limited transfer of travellers cheques which proved an inconvenience. The location of the hotel is excellent, away from the hustle and bustle of the tourist spots such as Union Square, but very central for excursions to Golden Gate Bridge and Park as well as Fisherman's Wharf, all of which were easily accessible by one or two convenient bus rides. Nowhere took more than 20 minutes to reach, and a handy shuttle service is available to the airport at a reasonable price. One of the few downsides was the hotel bar/restaurant, which specialised in Shabu Shabu Japanese cuisine. The service and food were fine, but it felt a bit unwelcoming and not the sort of place you'd want to spend long visiting. All in all, if you don't care about the hotel bar, an excellent choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Quinn7188
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located just on the edge of Japantown in San Francisco, so the style of the hotel is asian-influenced and very trendy. I liked the room and lobby decor the most. If you're looking for a quiet and comfortable place to stay, Hotel Tomo is it. But it's not exactly close to tourist spots like the Wharf, so you'll have to walk or take taxis. I definitely recommend this hotel for the price, service, and destination.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Japantown!”
Reviews.Author: norcalandlovinit
Reviews.Content: My family loves Japantown, and we come here all the time. This was our first time staying the night (we live 45 minutes away). I loved how convienant it was to everything in Japantown. You can walk to everything. My kids loved staying here. They have giant beanbag chairs, ipod docking alarm clocks, and fun decor. It's not fancy, but it is clean and fun. One tip I have is to park in the Japantown parking garage. You'll save a few bucks!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Carmenp
Reviews.Content: Got in late from LAX. Staff welcoming and friendly.Room was huge for 1 person and bed was comfy and soft. Bathrooms are bathrooms,do you really need a window?Shower was nice and hot and mirror/ basin good,nice touch with Japanese style toiletries. TV , Refridgerator in room were fine ,only that perhaps a glass or china mug for coffee would have been nice . Kettle for coffee/tea water heating is much better than coffee makers you find at some hotels. Room was spacious and mural added a little something extra.Very quiet and peaceful neighborhood ,much better than staying downtown. Close to Japanese eateries/stores and about a 5-10 minute walk to Fillmore for great food and unusual shops. Whole Foods Market a couple of blocks away for groceries/fruit and other items ,about 15 minutes walk on corner of California and Franklin.Otherwise there is a Safeway close by.Bus transport to downtown right outside.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay here”
Reviews.Author: angies-eye-patch
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and had a very pleasant stay. The reception staff were mostly very polite and helpful, however, there were a couple of people who let the side down. Our room was big and bright and had a bay window with a seat beneath it. The bathroom was quite small but functional. There was a large flat screen TV and a radio alarm clock with ipod docking station, however someone had snapped the ipod connector so we couldn't use this. The hotel's wireless internet was awful so I would not recommend this hotel for business use if you want to get some work done! The hotel lobby had two PCs which seemed to work much better and had free printing facilities, however there was often a queue to use them. The hotel had a fitness centre and the restaurant was very good. The only real issue we had, other than the internet, was that the bedroom doors are really heavy and bang quite loudly. As a result it could be a bit noisy at times. Other than this I would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value, fun decor”
Reviews.Author: sherrybomb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here our last night in San Francisco. We liked the location in Japantown, which had many restaurants and fun shops to explore. Bus service was convenient. We're not into the club/nightlife scene, so the location was great for us - our night there was quiet, though we did get a room 2 doors down from the squeaky elevator. We got a good prepaid rate from another website which was a factor for choosing this over other area hotels. The carpet in the room had some wear, but otherwise the room was clean and comfortable. The J-pop/anime/etc. touches were fun.

Reviews.Title: “Total waste of money”
Reviews.Author: traveleronlinenyc
Reviews.Content: This is more of a youth hostel than a real hotel. The beds were flat, pillows were not fluffy, they did not give us enough towels - not sure they even cleaned the room. The decor is cute, if kitschy, but the room's comfort level was very low. If Tomo were a $100/night hostel I would recommed it. But for the prices they charge you should stay somewhere nicer - much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “A really well located, friendly hotel that was clean and welcoming.”
Reviews.Author: whitecrane
Reviews.Content: I really wished we could have stayed longer. Although we arrived at 9am, the staff locked up our bags and provided us w/bus directions and also provided us (many times) w/change for the bus. We were able to reach all of our locations quickly and with minimum fuss w/ the public transportation system. The availabitlity of a wonderful pizza place, french bakery, deli and even a burger king make this a family friendly place. The anime decor appeals to adults as well as kids. We are planning a return trip to the city over the holidays and hope to repeat our stay!

Reviews.Title: “if you like Japan your like this. If not your still like it...”
Reviews.Author: RichardWiggett
Reviews.Content: After being told at the minute about our change of hotel I was a bit worried about this hotel because of the look of it. A bit old from the outside but as soon as you walk through the door you realise that this is a very VERY modern hotel with top of the range electronics. Plasma TV’s and sofa in the lounge and reception area it has a very Japanese feel to it as its in the Japanese district. But it’s Stunning. The Rooms are big with beautiful lamps wall paper. A Huge 42inch TV, IPod stand / alarm, Lazy boy in the corner. Free Internet, loads of space as well as a nice big bathroom with condiments thrown in. along with a Safe. It has its own Gym which is standard. And a restaurant that gets busy from external vistors. A nice hotel but out of the way you need to get a bus to get to union square and then the trams to the bay.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, but broken”
Reviews.Author: ktfaye
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Tomo. It was both good and bad, hence the middling rating. It's obviously an older best western re-done in a cute J-Pop style. The bedrooms themselves are funky and bright in an Ikea-meets-Japan sort of way. Very clean. Although, for reasons I can't understand, someone thought painting a windowless interior bathroom dark grey and adding an opaque dark gray shower curtain and installing a single low wattage florescent bulb was a good idea. Unless you're a fan of prisons, it wasn't. However, the shower had good water pressure and lots of hot water. Beds, linens, and towels and such were all of the quality I would expect of a mid-priced hotel. When we first checked in at the front desk in the late afternoon, the desk clerk was indifferent. He gave us the key card and we headed up to the room only to discover it wasn't what we had booked. We'd paid for an upgrade to a upper room with a balcony. So we schlep back downstairs. He gives us another room key to the right room. It was a very long traveling day so we decide to just get snacks at the market (nice to have one nearby!) and settle in for evening of being couch potatoes and watching pay-per-view. Except the pay per view movies didn't work. We call down stairs to inquire what the problem could be. Mr. Personality at the desk says he doesn't know, and "I don’t know what to tell you." When we indicate that it's really kinda his job to know these things, he tells us his colleague who actually knows something about the hotel systems will be in a half hour. As promised, a half hour or so later, the competent employee shows up. He fiddles with the cable box, indicates that it is indeed broken and offers to move us to yet another room. So we switch rooms for a third time. In fairness, the nighttime employee was very helpful and accommodating, he apologized, brought a cart to tote the luggage and gave us a free pass for a couple breakfasts at the hotel dining room. That was nice, considering the day-shift guy's attitude was "hey, sucks to be you." While the hotel offers free wireless, forget actually trying to use it for more than a couple minutes at a time. It's intermittent at best and drops out constantly. They outsource the service and it took multiple phone calls to get the service running. Even with help, it's not consistent. If you actually plan on doing some work, you will be frustrated. The next day, again, we come back to the room that night to find that TV and lamp in the desk area isn't working. We fiddle with the surge protector under the desk to no avail. We call down. Guy comes up. Apparently the surge protector has to be "jiggled" just right in the outlet. I can only guess that the maid accidently unjiggled it while sweeping. (frankly the wiring and multiple extension cords all looked like a fire waiting to happen) On the day we left, we went to the house computers to print out our boarding passes. Attached to both the computers were "out of order signs" indicating that they wouldn't be fixed until the next day. The woman at the desk was nice enough to log on and print out the passes. That evening, I I had to go to three different floors to find a coke machine that actually worked. No exaggeration. So we met two very good employees and one very indifferent one. The room was nice, the bathroom was creepy and there were multiple issues with the amenities. The front desk did eventually make some monetary adjustments for all of the inconveniences, and that was nice, of course. I don't expect perfection, but I do expect problems to be corrected, alleviated, or compensated, which eventually they were. But equally, they would not have had to make such concessions IF items just worked as they are intended to in the first place. While the hotel is cute and it's in a nice location, but they really need to put some money into their infrastructure. I'd still recommend it as we seemed to have a run of bad luck, but if you're not a patient person, you might want to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, stylish hotel at decent price”
Reviews.Author: F.O.B.-traveler
Reviews.Content: This sad, old hotel on the edge of calm Japantown and trendy Pacific Heights got a great make-over. The theme is "mod" Japanese. Rooms: huge (many have spectacular views); terrific beds; small refrigerators; safes for valuables; immaculate. Nearby: dozens of Japanese restaurants and shops (try Genji's for antiques or the two-floor bookstore), the Sundance movie theaters and Kabuki Hot Springs spa; Japanese grocery store with delicious, fresh meals to go. Ten-minute walk: Fillmore Street's trendy restaurants/shops (Dosa for amazing California-Indian food, Osaka for terrific sushi and Peet's for best coffee). Great bus service to get you around the city (no subway in this part of town). Huge Safeway 3-4 blocks away. I paid $109/night for my room. A friend paid $10/night more for his. Downside: The free wireless is awful (there are two computers in the lobby and the coffee shops on Fillmore Street all off free wireless). The parking is limited and expensive, although there's a second lot two blocks away. It's a pain to get to BART for the train to airport (although there's a $16 shuttle). Some may prefer to be down near Union Square for more mass transit and shopping options (but it's also very touristy).

Reviews.Title: “a little J-pop culture in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: deepcover
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a one night stay at the Hotel Tomo. We had a double Queen room with balcony on the top floor, great views of San Francisco and the Peace Pagoda. The room was clean, and furnished in fun style with bright bedspreads, a cool wall mural taken from some anime movie, and even Japanese style toiletries. The staff was nice, and the parking conveniently next door to the hotel. My teenagers loved the Japanese styling and lobby videos, but I didn't see any of the game consoles I had expected. In addition the wifi was very slow, both in the rooms and in the complimentary terminals in the lobby. The gym in the hotel was tiny, a converted room I think, but had fresh air. The neighbourhood is different for San Francisco, not near the tourist attractions but very charming in its own way. I have an interest in Japanese culture, so I enjoyed the historic plaques posted on buildings as well as the Japanese mall and restaurants close by. If you walk to nearby Filmore Street, you can check out some ritzy shopping as well as the interesting architecture of Pacific Heights. And you don't see tourists everywhere as you do downtown. We stayed here one night and two in the Union Square area. I booked at the last minute and I thought that at $193 the room was a little pricey, but if you could get a better deal it would be a great place to explore a different side of San Francisco in a very fun environment.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay in the heart of Japantown!”
Reviews.Author: Jeanna18
Reviews.Content: We received excellent service, and convenience to downtown SF. The rooms were very clean and the beds comfortable. Would stay here again if we have a chance to return to SF!

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for unscrupulous charging practices.”
Reviews.Author: farandwidengland
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it is only 4 blocks from the hospital where my brother had emergency surgery. It is a clean hotel at a reasonable price. After my third night here I found out that they had already debited my checking account for more than $800. What a surprise, since the rate was approximately $90/night including taxes and fees. Here's what they explained to me: The company policy is to charge your credit card for the entire length of your reservation when you arrive. In addition, they charge an additional $50 per night for possible "incidental" expenses! When you check out, if you have not stayed the entire time, or used any "incidentals," your bank will release the funds not spent. These policies are not posted or printed, nor did the person who told me to reserve an entire week and cancel the nights I don't need later. I have stayed in many hotels in throughout the US and in Europe and have never experienced this before. In the future I would not stay at this hotel again because they do not inform the guests of this policy.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Tomo is convenient and well-appointed, with excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: dosterling
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 4-night stay at Hotel Tomo. Our room on the sixth floor was bright, clean, beautifully decorated in a Japanese motif, and very quiet -- no street noise at all, although it is located on a busy street (Sutter). Japan Town is directly across the street and is full of great restaurants in all price ranges. Also across the street is a bus line that goes directly to Union Square and Market Street. (Seniors unfamiliar with San Francisco should be aware that the senior rate is 50 cents to ride anywhere on the bus.) Service at Hotel Tomo was really excellent. Several times we called for replacement items of Kleenex, etc., and housekeeping was at our door within minutes. There were at least two people manning the reception desk at all times, so we never had to wait in line if we had a question. Two additional bonuses: Free wireless internet (or the desk will also provide a cable), and a very nice "Little Gym" with a rubberized floor, mats, free weights, a treadmill, an elyptical, and a bike. There were only two very minor things that were a bit less than satisfactory to us. One, the room doors were impossible to close without that final "slam," so as late sleepers, we were awakened around 7:45 each morning as other guests began leaving their rooms. Secondly, we ate breakfast two mornings in the hotel restaurant, and we found it to be a bit on the greasy side. All in all, our stay at Hotel Tomo was wonderful, and a very, very good value for the money. We've stayed in many San Francisco hotels, but I think from now on, depending on their rates at the time, this one will be our first choice -- especially since it's just a short walk to our daughter's condo!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Tomo is such a fun place and a great value!”
Reviews.Author: welove2trvl
Reviews.Content: The staff at Hotel Tomo were fantastic. We were able to check in early and check out late which made our stay so much better for just a quick overnight. We love the Japanese pop culture theme. It is so much fun. A slice of Japan in San Francisco. Really fun place to be. The staff seems genuinely happy to be there and they are so helpful. We will definitely be back. What a great deal so close to Japantown.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: dmhrLA
Reviews.Content: We needed to be in that area to see a concert at the Fillmore-could walk to the venue...located in Japantown and the rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable, internet in the rooms was free, the hotel was very quiet-we opted for a balcony room which had a nice view (8th floor)-couldn't really sit on the patio but you could stand out there. The desk help was really friendly and accomodating-when we needed more blankets and towels very late at night we had them right away...parking was reasonable as well, and you could walk to various types of restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and had iLuv iPod player but inconvenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Rapacity
Reviews.Content: The iLuv didn't work when we got there, and they replaced it right away with one that worked. I noticed video game controllers, but I didn't play anything. It was clean, but there were no bell hops and the lobby was really small. They didn't have any parking available, so we had to park down the street for $30/day. They do have a bar/sushi restaurant, but we only had drinks there. I wish I would have stayed in Union Square for my entire visit instead of at the Tomo. It is too cold in San Francisco to wait for cabs! The room was clean and comfortable, but I wouldn't go back. The money that you save by staying here is instantly eaten up by cabs. I stayed at the Hilton in Union Square for the rest of my trip, and it was much more convenient (no cabs needed). I still parked down the street for $20/day (this time because the Hilton's parking garage was $50/day).

Reviews.Title: “Fun and friendly stay in San Fransisco!”
Reviews.Author: JBWeaver
Reviews.Content: Hotel Tomo is a very unique hotel. The Japanese pop art decor was so much fun to look at. The rooms were very clean. Loved the giant bean bag. Beds are very firm, but we slept well. Helpful front desk staff. The guys in the restaurant downstairs were awesome. We only ate breakfast there, and although the food isn't gourmet, the cook and waiter more than made up for it with character!

Reviews.Title: “Maybe just one night for the experience”
Reviews.Author: ekswl
Reviews.Content: I had read about this hotel in various magazines & online sources so I thought I'd give it a try rather than stick with a safe hotel choice. The man at the front desk was very curt when checking me in - just "sign here" "give me your credit card" etc. No one offered to help with my bag. When I got to my room on the first floor, I was quite amused by the mural, but other than that it was just a Best Western room filled with IKEA furniture. I found that the Japanese pop theme this hotel claims to be based on could have been played up more from a design standpoint and the real J-Pop fans who seek this hotel may be disappointed. The bathroom was a typical Best Western bathroom and the shower area was very dark. The room was fairly clean, though, and it was a different experience. The bed is comfortable and the linens are decent. I'm a fan of the location - safe area with many eating choices, supermarkets, bus stop right in front of the hotel, away from the bustle of tourists. The hotel provides complimentary hi-speed internet access, but the wi-fi was unusably slow. I asked for a network cable to hard-wire my laptop to the desk, even then I had to adjust the DNS settings for it to work. I hated being chained to the desk, in that horrible plastic chair! I ate at the Mums restaurant and the shabu shabu was very good. But because my room was on the same floor as the restaurant, I could smell the meat cooking in my room in the evening, which was very unpleasant. The walls are very thin and I could hear every footstep and conversational tone of voice in the hallway late at night. In conclusion, if you want to try a different kind of hotel, Hotel Tomo may be worth staying for one night - at a good rate. What I paid was not a good rate for a stay at a Best Western.

Reviews.Title: “A nifty little place!”
Reviews.Author: Leighmundo
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Expedia after looking at the reviews on Trip Advisor. On arriving at San Francisco Airport we took a short (40mins) shuttle bus drive to the hotel, which is situated in the heart of the city's Japan Town. There was no trouble with our room and although we were on the 8th floor, the lift was speedy. The room itself was bright and airy and really quite large. The hotel is based on a Japanese theme, and our room had a flavor of the East, with futon stle furniture and a quite odd but funky mural covering one room. We liked the room! There was a dressing area with a lit sink and wardrobe, the bath, shower and toilet were in a separate room, and were a tad dark. The staff were always very friendly and answered any questions we had. There is a restaurant atached to the hotel. We ate there the first night, and although the staff were lovely, the food was average, so didn't go back. There are plenty of Asian restaurants in the area, with a shopping centre 2minutes walk from the hotel. Directly opposite the hotel is a deli, which sold nice sandwiches! The hotel had icemachines and drinks machines on alternate floors, however we had to go to floor 4 to find a working ice-machine and the restrooms in the lobby were out of service for our stay. However there was free internet access with a printer available in the lobby! There was also a small gym, which my partner used once. The rooms were cleaned everyday with the hotel operating a policy where you put a card on the bed if you want new sheets and towels in the bath if you want them replacing. The room also had an iron and ironing board which was great! Added extras included a funky i-pod alarm clock and a flat screen TV! Location was fine. The area was fairly quiet and we felt safe. Bus stops to all areas of SF were within minutes walk and taxi's were always readily hailed. Down the road from the Tomo is a hotel called the "Queen Anne" where a ghost tour is held every night at 7pm for £20, quite cool! We both felt that we had gotton a good deal with the Tomo, a hotel nearer the city centre would have been too hectic.

Reviews.Title: “modern and unique”
Reviews.Author: steve-h132
Reviews.Content: Does not feel like a typical US hotel, the halls are small, and lobby has video games and anime. Room was normal size and had the usual amenities but with bold mural and solid colors. I liked it but some people might hate it. It is a long walk from Bart, so non-athletic people need to take taxi or bus to get there. The restaurant serves Japanese food no surprise, but there probably are better ones in neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great for weekend trips!”
Reviews.Author: hypermusic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel TOMO on a whim. We were attending the San Francisco International Film Festival and a late night horror film kept us from traveling home that night. We decided to stay at the Hotel Tomo and boy what a decision that was! Me and my Nephew are jPop fanatics! Everything from Anime to Japanese rock music are awesome to us. The hotel had a very jPop feel to it. It was very funky! The rooms were big enough (although because we had three people in one room we ended up sharing beds). The showers were a little low and there was a strange smell throughout the hotel. All the cons aside, Hotel TOMO is a very cool place to stay when looking for a hip hotel (for a more traditional japanese hotel experience, try the Hotel Kabuki right down the street)

Reviews.Title: “Good value; odd decor”
Reviews.Author: Rappongi27
Reviews.Content: This Japan Town hotel does have some Japanese character to it, including the odd wall murals in the room, along with the only wood grain carpeting I've ever seen. The lamp by the bed was not sufficient to read by. The beds were hard, the number of towels few, and the furniture was not especially comfortable. On the other hand, there was inside parking (for $20) and the price for SF was decent. So it was ok, but nothing to write home about. If looking for no frills and clean, and not interested in staying downtown, it is worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “A tad far from the action of SF, but with a nice cheaper price tag and convenient buses”
Reviews.Author: MsJulicious
Reviews.Content: This is definitely a great place to stay in a wonderful location at a great price. The front desk personnel are very curteous and accomodating (for $125-160 a night, they give top-notch service). The hotel decor was so whimsical and perfect for the Japanese pop culture / video game / anime / manga fanatic. They even have a restaurant downstairs that opens really early for breakfast and has a bar that is open until late night hours. Their wireless internet is free and very reliable. They also have a safe in each room so if you have a laptop or other valuables, you can safely store it in the room. Let me also add that there is already an iron and ironing board, so don't worry about packing one like I did. Lol. In addition, the location was very convenient. Not only was it right across the street from Japantown -- Bus Lines 2, 3, 4 pass through the bus stop across the street and 4 blocks north (beware of the hills!!!) is another bus stop (Bus Line 1) that takes you a few blocks away from the Ferry Building. The area is pretty safe and quiet. A lot of the restaurants in Japantown stay open so there is still plenty to do late at night. However, I do want to add that almost every night I did hear sirens in the distance. But I'm not sure how close by they were. There were only a few down sides. The walls were not always thick enough (a light-sleeper friend of mine woke up to the sounds of people next door) and he was allergic to the goose down in the pillows. We came in after a night out and there wasn't any water available in the vending machine. Also, the lighting in the room was a bit too dim for my liking, and I couldn't find the switch to turn the heater on. (Did my room even have a heater? Lol. I should have called the front desk.) And if you have leftovers, I don't know how you would warm it up. My room didn't have a microwave. Other than that, my stay here was great, and I'd still highly recommend this hotel (with a warning for the light-sleepers Lol). For the price, convenience, and location, you can't find a better place to stay in the City.

Reviews.Title: “Great Japantown Location & Value”
Reviews.Author: trvljnkyLasVegas
Reviews.Content: This was a good value. Had balcony room which was large, comfortable and clean. Japantown has easy bus access to downtown, Market St, the Castro and GG Park. Good restaurants in the area. Staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. Neighborhood is quiet and clean. Wifi was hit or miss, slow, but free.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: lordchaff
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Hotel Tomo after snowboarding in Tahoe and were done in. We checked in with a lot of luggage and there wasn't even an offer of assistance to our room. We got given a room on the 4th floor and proceeded to unpack our stuff quickly before heading down to Fillmore, so + points to the hotel for location. When we got back in there was a really bad and loud noise coming from outside our room that appeared to be coming from the air conditioning. We had to go to reception and ask for a room change, the receptionist wasn't very forth coming. So it was pack up all our stuff again and move to another room, a bit of an annoyance. All in all, an ok stay, not brilliant but not one of the worst.

Reviews.Title: “Coolest hotel we've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Matju
Reviews.Content: Our trip to California ended with San Francisco and we wanted to stay in different part of S.F. and boy we are sooo glad that we choose this hotel. Its cool, weird (cool weird), japan animated walls, and the room was sooo coool. The walls were painted with manga images and it was very comfy. We were invited to taste Sake in the rec room and we could play with the Nintendo WII The hotel is situated in the heart of Japan town so you can walk all around this really great part of S.F. The restaurant that is part of the hotel , is very cool We get to eat Shabu Shabu (japanese meat fondu) and make a reservation because it can get crowded from locals and tourists. This is the coolest hotel we've stayed in and we would go back there anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Quirky Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SactoScuba
Reviews.Content: We liked the hotel. I would consider it a budget 2-star hotel in excellent shape. The furniture was simple "ikea" style. The wall murals were neat. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. At $99 nt it is priced right - but no higher! Pros: comfortable bed, decor is unique, food was good at the restaurant, clean, not worn out (yet), Cons: dim lighting in the bathroom, wireless internet was not working in our room (had to be tethered to an ethernet cable), would of loved some lobby coffee or snacks, limited parking! Didn't like their very basic bath toiletries. Only 1 bathrobe in the room. TV remote was difficult - you have to push, push and push the buttons for them to finally work. We would stay here again for a good location, and rightly-priced hotel in the City.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Tomo surpassed my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: StellaJD
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised to be writing such a stellar review for this hotel after reading many of the comments from other reviewers. I anticipated having the same problems - rude service, slamming doors, lousy wifi connection, and fickle heating. However, given the uniqueness of Hotel Tomo, I was willing to give it a shot. I honestly can say that this hotel far surpassed my expectations and catered to all of my needs for my trip (efficient service, quiet floor, clean room, cool environment). Having said this, readers should keep in mind that this hotel IS a mid-range Best Western, and is neither a five star hotel nor a hostel. You won't get room service or ear-to-ear smiles from the staff, but you needn't worry about comfort, cleanliness, or safety. The service was great - I checked in quite late without any hitches, asked directions and questions of the front desk, and requested taxis from the staff. As my return flight was at 10 pm, the staff was quite amiable about storing my luggage, and actually refused a tip upon retrieving my bags! What prompted me to give this hotel an "excellent" score was the fact that a personalized letter from the head housekeeper was left on my desk, and the "guest experience" manager left a message on my phone to call her extension if I needed anything during my stay. During my visits to much higher end hotels, I only received these types of gestures when doing business with these properties. As just a "regular" guest, I found their messages quite personal and reassuring. The wifi worked perfectly, as did the tea kettle, alarm clock, A/C, and in-room safe. Yuzu-bergamot toiletries and the cushy robe were nice touches, and it was nice waking up to my own music on my ipod. A printer and two computers are available in the lobby for printing out boarding passes, maps, etc. Location is a bit far from the touristy parts of SF, but dead in the heart of Japantown. It was nice to be able to grab take-out ramen from Tanpopo and be back in my room within 5 minutes. A great Korean spa is only a few minutes away as well. A few minor CONS: Housekeeping staff did come knocking at my door at 8:30 am. Fortunately, I was already up, but for those wanting to sleep late, remember to hang that "Do Not Disturb" sign before you turn out the lights. Free breakfast may be too much to ask for, but putting complimentary coffee/tea/fruit in the lobby would be a nice touch. Overall, I would definitely stay here again. If you're not a fan of anime or don't have a sense of humor about the Tomo's decor (i.e., you're "scared" of the room murals!), I would advise you to look elsewhere. For all those looking for a unique experience at a decent rate, I would recommend this place wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Coolest Best Western I've stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: bettyo70
Reviews.Content: I think whoever had the idea to re-design this Best Western hotel with a "Japanimation" theme is a genius! I wish more small hotels in American cities would convert into art-themed hotels like the Tomo. We enjoyed the concept and the decor. The murals in the rooms and in the hotel restaurant were really cool. The vending machine in the lobby selling $35 gifts was funny, but I was too broke to partake in this. I appreciated the convenient, free internet access in the lobby. The gym had a nice view of the surrounding neighborhood of Japantown, though it was COLD in that room when I went. I took off one star because: 1) breakfast is NOT included when you book; 2) I wish the "gaming rooms" were open when we went so that we could enjoy the decor -- these rooms were closed when we were there; and 3) the week we were there, they did not have the free sake that they usually have for the hotel guests (for some reason, they suspended Hospitality Hour the week of Christmas).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Tomo is Quirky, Clean, Fun!”
Reviews.Author: castlegirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family over Christmas and completely fell in love with this little hotel! In addition to providing us with a comfortable stay in a clean room, there is character running rampant throughout this establishment. The decor is funky tech, from the anime-themed wall murals and Pac Man colors in the halls to the flat-screen TVs and iPod alarm clocks. Comfort, however, is not lost in the novelty. The beds and blankets were soft, the shower was warm and a restaurant on the second floor served a filling breakfast (they served Western egg plates as well as Japanese fish and noodle dishes). The location in Japan Town is ideal for those wanting to avoid the noisy tourist areas but still see a unique, authentic part of San Francisco with restaurants and shopping nearby. The service is not "4-star" - don't expect bellhops or concierge service - but neither is the price, and the people at the desk were friendly and attentive. I definitely will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: exploradores
Reviews.Content: We are travelers who like good deals, and never stay in fancy five-star hotels. We found this hotel to be well-priced, clean, quiet, and located in a very safe neighbourhood. The rooms had a funky decor which added to the experience. The beds were very comfortable. We did not rent a car, so we took the city's fabulous transit system, which by the way, there is a bus stop right outside the door to the hotel. Our favorite place to hang out was the North Beach area, and it was only a 20 minute bus ride!! The hotel is also located steps away from the Pacific Heights district, which is a beautiful area of the city with great shopping, restaurants, etc. We love San Fran, and would definitely stay at Hotel Tomo again!

Reviews.Title: “Good central location in the middle of Japan Town”
Reviews.Author: crash014
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Tomo after comparing the price with the Hotel Kabuki just a few blocks away, the Holiday rate they were offering was good. Located at the entrance of the Japan Town shopping area and surrounded by a neighborhood that is well-kept, this area was very safe compared to when I stayed in Union Square, Market Street, North Beach previously. The room was nice with a good king-sized bed. Opt for the 8th floor room (top) if you can since you will have a great view of the city and unobstructed scene as well. Front desk was accomodating for directions around town and a quick check in and out as well. Parking was $20 which is average for the area. Wifi connection was wonky for me and the Best Western tech support line was not helpful, got to piggy back on another non-hotel wifi though. Comes with small room fridge. As noted in other reports, the t.v. remote control was not easy to use and sometimes missing buttons. Transferred from a different room when the smoke detector started beeping due to low battery and no technician was around. Good location, good service.

Reviews.Title: “liked it”
Reviews.Author: janneman10
Reviews.Content: had a room on the sixth floor with a nice few over the city the room was clean,very large with good beds, we payed about 70 euro for a night, for us a good deal considering the place the people were very friendly and the hotel is pleasantly situated in japan town breakfast is so so and a little to much expencive busstop to pier 39 is just in front of the hotel and costs you 2 dollar, also there are a lot of restaurants nearby we had a good time in Tomo hotel, thank you again

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: CassianoLuminati
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7 days in a King Deluxe Room, first floor. Very clean. Big room. Free WIFI. Hotel is in a good location in a safe and quite area of the city, just at the entrance of the Japan Center. Close to many restaurants and shops. MUNI Bus station to city center just in front of the hotel. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, family friendly”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMom02
Reviews.Content: We made reservations at the Hotel Tomo before discovering it had received good reviews in an article in Sunset Magazine months before. The Japantown location was central to our travels. The surrounding neighborhood is very residential, and we were able to easily park for free in the neighborhood each night. The hotel does offer parking for a fee, but it was not necessary. We usually were able to find a spot within a block or two of the hotel. The rooms are very comfortable and a good size for 2 adults and 2 children. The restaurant was loud (it is very popular). The first night we stayed in a room on the ground level which was noisy from the street and the restaurant. We requested a quieter room for the next 2 nights and the front desk staff was very accommodating. The room we stayed in on a higher floor was quite quiet. We thought the room rates were reasonable, especially for San Francisco. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Tomo!”
Reviews.Author: atljs
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Tomo in Sept 2008. I'm a graphic designer and I really appreciate moderately priced hotels with style. When I came across articles about Hotel Tomo on some design-related websites, I was very interested. After doing more research and learning its location in Japantown, I knew I'd love it. When I travel I don't like to stay in touristy areas (so boring and monotonous), but at the same time I want easy access to wherever I want to go. Tomo didn't disappoint. There are plenty of MUNI bus stops just steps from the hotel. Cabs are pretty easy to come by as well (or the front desk can call one for you). With its location, you're also just 2 blocks from Fillmore St., where there are some great shops and restaurants. I also loved Kinokuniya Bookstore across the street from the hotel, in the little mall. My room with a king sized bed was really cool (loved the mural, the furniture, and the wood grain carpet!), but more importantly it was very clean. The only minor thing, which I knew ahead of time from reading TripAdvisor reviews, is that there's a daycare or something with kids right by the hotel. I was on the 4th floor and could hear the kids playing outside. But it wasn't enough to annoy me or make me not want to stay there again. Overall I thought Hotel Tomo was a great value for San Francisco. It's in a great, but not touristy location. You're just a short walk to many restaurants and shops. I'd stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant times in Tomo”
Reviews.Author: malissophobia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Tomo back in the last week of June. It was a really nice place. The front desk people were very helpful. They told us about getting around on the bus and called a cab for us one night when we were going out late and the buses had stopped running for the night. The bus stop is right across the street! It was super convienant. The rooms were nice. We had two queen beds, and they were nice and stiff. Very comfortable. I slept really well. Since there were three of us staying in there, I was going to get extra pillows, however, when I opened the bottom dresser drawer, there was a pillow waiting in there and in the 2nd drawer a feather comforter. :) The "Do Not Disturb" signs were really cute. They did call and ask when we left it up for more than a day if we were sleeping or wanted our room cleaned. Oops. haha I loved the giant bean bag thing. I think it was called a Fat Boy. That was nice. The window seat was really lovely. It was totally hard, but nice. We would set up the table by it since the table only has 2 chairs and play cards there at night. They had wireless which was really nice to be able to use the laptop. However, if you don't have a laptop, they do have computers in the lobby you can use. The restuarant was alright. We had breakfast there one morning. I got pancakes. They were ok. The service was very prompt though and friendly. Parking. The ramp, we could use one of the two nights we had a car. It was cool, I'm just glad we had a compact car though! The second night, we parked across the street at the mall ramp. That worked out well. It was only like $15 for overnight, and the spaces weren't so cramped. Japantown seemed very safe and was pretty convienant. I liked it. For the price, you really can't beat hotel tomo. It's simple, clean and fun. The staff is extremely helpful and knowledgable. The front desk booked shuttles for us to get back to the airport. All three of us had different flights. They let us split the room three ways and pay at all different times the day we checked out. It was very cool of them to let us do that so we didn't have to worry about that. As I said, I loved the hotel. The staff was great, our room was clean. The bathroom was nice. They had in inroom safe. It was very cool. I loved the lamps, the curtains, the sheets. Fun times!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect For Shows At The Fillmore!!!”
Reviews.Author: michaelmelton1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to see Bloc Party at the Fillmore, and chose this hotel due to its proximity to the venue. Once we checked in, we fell in love. It has a Modern Hostel feel to it...sort of felt like we were europe...or japan. The hotel is located directly in the middle of Japan Town, and there are tons of great noodle restaurants within a stones throw. Not to mention all the Japanese and Korean markets. All-in-all, this was the perfect hotel for our tastes, and any show at the Fillmore.

Reviews.Title: “Great value & a fun vibe!”
Reviews.Author: Quintana88
Reviews.Content: Great value and lots of fun. I stayed there for a long weekend with infant son and my mother and would highly recommend the hotel. Pluses: *Excellent value: very comfortable, clean, and thoughtfully appointed rooms all for a reasonable price *Great staff: Staff were very friendly and helpful - e.g., with bags, advice on getting around, parking, etc. *Fun vibe: Love the Japanime/Manga theme decor! Adds an energy to the place - unusual as most hotels in this price range are the same drab fluorescent-lit boxes *Easy location: Japantown is cute to walk around in & it is an easy bus or taxi into Union Square. A plus that in Japantown you don't have to deal with the madness of the crowds in Union Square Minuses: *This is not a luxury hotel/treat hotel - but it doesn't pretend to be I'd definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A quirky makeover”
Reviews.Author: JoeyLondon
Reviews.Content: You get the feeling that the Hotel Tomo has been on the end of a extreme makeover. Someone has rushed in there one morning and decided to turn it Japanese by sticking up murals in each room, replacing dated furniture with trendy minimalism and putting Japanese soap in the bathrooms. It is mostly cosmetic, and underneath it is simply a Best Western, but there’s enough quirky coolness to make for an interesting stay. The rooms are extremely comfy and there are some nice extras like the docking station for an iPod. The sports channels on our TV were faulty and front desk failed to fix it (probably to the relief of my girlfriend) but they were exceptionally friendly so we’ll let them off. Location wise, it’s close to a number of bus routes so you can get to different areas like Castro or Downtown with ease. And, it should go without saying, but it’s the perfect place to stay if you want to eat lots and lots of great Japanese food. Especially at the bakery across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Very cute hotel with extremely friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Spikeandjezebel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Tomo for our anniversary. When I bought our tickets, I used their website and also became a member (for free) of their hotel's membership club.
