That meant that we received a complimentary bottle of wine in our room upon arrival. I also included in the notes to the hotel that it was our second wedding anniversary. They left a bottle of champagne in our room and a Hotel Tomo t-shirt with a card saying that the second anniversary is the cotton anniversary. It was thoughtful of them. There were robes in the room for us, and Jimmy, who showed us the room when we arrived was very friendly. We got a call about ten minutes after getting into our room from the front desk asking if everything was satisfactory. Apparently that's what they do at Joie de Vivre hotels, because we stayed at a different one the day before, and they also called after check-in. The hotel room was adorable, and the bed, which was like a futon, was firm but comfortable. The room had a lot of character, was clean, and new. I would absolutely stay there again. I liked being in Japantown. It was a different way to see San Francisco, outside of the business of downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Hotel Tomo”
Reviews.Author: jetsetbb
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a short stay at Hotel Tomo. This hotel is soooo cool! The decor is amazing. Rooms are very clean and decent size. We had a small balcony with a view of the neighborhood. It is located in Japantown. It is not walking distance to the main attractions, but you can take a cab for about $6-7 into union square. Or you can take a bus. I usually always stay in Union Square when visiting San Francisco, but I really enjoyed staying in a different location. It's very quiet and safe to walk around even late at night. There are tons of great restaurants around the hotel. The Hotel even has a cool shabu-shabu restaurant. However I did not get a chance to eat there. The staff is very friendly and helpful. It is a great deal too. Much less than all the other hotels in touristy areas of San Francisco. I will totally stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Tomo, a pleasure to stay at!”
Reviews.Author: MrSmid
Reviews.Content: Travelling around the USA is a great thing. Staying in excellent hotels during the trip is even greater! Hotel Tomo was one of them and I certainly advise this hotel to everyone who likes to stay in a nice quiet neighbourhood close to downtown San Francisco. The nice people at the front desk gave us a warm welcome and even gave us a phonecall 10 mins after we entered our room, just to make sure everything was alright. We had a double bed (excellent beds by the way) room, with an LCD television, a radio (you could even hook your iPod up it), a nice shower and badroom. The cleaning staff were extremely friendly and did a great job! I had a real good time at Hotel Tomo, it was a real pleasure to stay there !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: seedeebee
Reviews.Content: We took our son and his girlfriend to San Francisco for their graduation trip. They are both Anime fans so we chose this hotel for the theme. The room was comfortable for the four of us for five days. The location was the best! Not only was it right in Japan Town and only a block from Japan Center, it is on a major muni route. We parked the car and didn't worry about it until we left. We were less than 30 minutes from everything we wanted to see, the Haight, Union Square, Pier 39 and many museums. The staff was helpful and cordial the whole time. There is limited parking at the hotel but they use the Japan Center lot as overflow and were very helpful with loading and unloading. The view was terrific and the rooms clean and well kept. We will stay there whenever we go to the City in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Best Tomo!!”
Reviews.Author: dolphinface
Reviews.Content: We booked through Orbitz and used Orbitz's summer 10% coupon code. The only hotel with two Queen beds within our price range, and surprisingly, there were no other hidden charges upon checking in. The receptionist was a little stingy about giving out four bus maps. However, the room was very clean and very roomy. There is a huge bean bag chair and also a bench by the window. We stayed on 2nd floor but not noisy at all. The room decor is very modern and to our likings. Room has extra blankets which came in handy on cold SF nights while we were there. Close to Bus # 2, 3, 4, 22 and I believe 32 which can take you to union square, golden gate bride and alamo square park. We bought a 3 days muni pass for $ 18 at union sq and used it to take buses, cable car and street car all three days. Japanese food and Japan center was really good at very decent price compare to NY's.

Reviews.Title: “Tomo not that bad!”
Reviews.Author: GregS76
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Tomo for two nights last Sept. while in town for some concerts at the Fillmore. I thought the hotel was fine, and we didn't have any problems with noise as some of the other reviews have stated, so either we got lucky, or we are heavy sleepers which is definitely not the case. The hotel itself is okay, it was recently redone so everything was very new looking, and the decor is exactly what you would expect from this type of place. If you are staying a j-pop themed hotel, don't expect antiquity or that nothing will look like plastic. I thought that the rooms were very spacious, and the bed was a good size and comfortable. The location is just okay, but we chose this specific hotel in mind as it is within easy walking distance to the Fillmore. There's obviously plenty of great Japanese restaurants around here too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you like Japantown”
Reviews.Author: Family_from_NJ
Reviews.Content: The room has IKEA like furniture, simple, modern and serve its purpose. The bean bag chair is not as comfortable as it looks. It has a ipod docking alarm clock which my daughter likes and a LCD TV. It is located right in the Japantown, so it is very convenient if you like Japanese food at reasonable price. Japan Center has other stores too. It is a fun experience to browse and walk around. When we came back late one night, the hotel parking was full so I had to park at the Japan Center. With the receipt, the hotel waive the over night parking fee. It is a very short walk and I find it safe walking at night. There is a Japanese cafe right across the street from the hotel. We had the breakfast there. Many locals stop there so you get a local feel. The bakery makes mochi (rice cake) there. It is delicious so we bought a box to go. The bakery has been in busuiness for many years. The price is reasonable. It is clean and convenient. Overall, we like the hotel and will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Tomo”
Reviews.Author: DianeDee
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of Japan Town a wonderful but little known part of San Francisco is the Best Western Tomo! Our stay was fantastic. Every person we dealt with at the hotel couldn't have been nicer, our room was immaculate and simple. A perfect combination of Japanese and Western design, very comfortable and pleasant. The greatest was the parking. The hotel charges a modest $20.00 per night parking fee, a bargain in San Francisco. If their small parking lot is full as it was one night they send you to the public parking lot aroung the corner and reminburse the parking fee. They have a small restaurant in the hotel, we only had breakfast there but it was very good. The Tomo is now our go to place when visiting San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: thebee
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel tucked in the heart of SF. My daughter and I stayed there to attend a memorial for an uncle. Auntie lived near by and this seemed convenient. My daughter LOVED the manga art and design. The price was excellent, the food in the restaurant was GREAT. Clean, neat and well done....I am liking Bestwestern more and more. In the heart of Japan Town...safe and clean and fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience At Hotel Tomo”
Reviews.Author: denmarkd
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in SF and I'm very happy we stayed here. The prices were as great as the service. Location was great, right inside Japantown with a bustop in front headed to downtown(really made our 3day passes worth it). It's also not too far from the California St. Cablecar. Check-in was quick and easy and went straight to the room. Rooms were everything we hoped for and more. We were on the third floor and both rooms were clean, cozy, and had nice views of Japantown. Never had a problem with the complimentary internet(had two macs with us) which was great. Doors closed a little hard but no big deal. Even a few friends from SF came to visit were impressed enough to decide to recommend it and also plan to stay themselves in the future. Service was great all around, we left a jacket there that somehow got stuck under the mattress/bed and they flipped the room upside down to find it. Dara and Gill were extremely quick and helpful in contacting me. Thanks guys!
